ResponsesInList.Title: Looking to map courses to a competency framework
ResponsesInList.Text: I would like to download the course name and the "about this course" page to enable mapping existing courses to a digital health competency framework created by WHO and / or a framework created by other entities such as world bank.  Is there a way to create a listing of specified courses and the description so that we can map them (100 - 200+ courses) to the appropriate frameworks?

ResponsesInList.Title: Looking to map courses to a competency framework
ResponsesInList.Text: You could create that list using SQL or Custom Reports (this took less that one minute on my site). I don't know how this will help you map them to the appropriate Competency frameworks? The frameworks are ancient, unforgiving structures.

ResponsesInList.Title: Allow Students to Add Competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone! I'm supporting a school that already uses CBL in their transition to Moodle from fully offline. Besides academic competencies, students are expected to self-evaluate and then work on a couple of soft skills per semester, in alignment with the school's graduate profile. I have enabled the capabilities competency:planviewowndraft and competency:planmanageowndraft for the authenticated user role, which worked fine. However, it quickly became overwhelming since students could see all the academic frameworks. I would like to find a way to restrict students from adding academic competencies to their individual plan. I have tried the following: Setting the soft skills framework to a category and creating a new role, at the category level, with the above capabilities. This didn't work (I suspect because learning plans exist at the user level) Doing the opposite, with the academic frameworks in a category, and setting competency:competencyview to prevent. The list looks clean but students are not allowed to view their rating, proficiency, etc. If there is no other option, I'll use tours to guide them, but I'd really appreciate any ideas you might have! Thank you, Inês

ResponsesInList.Title: Allow Students to Add Competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: I turned off all of those capabilities because we didn't want our student creating their own competencies, but I believe if you want to "hide" the competencies from the students just change the visible flag, to No. The admins can still see the competencies, but the students do not. You would need to test if other roles, Teachers/graders whatever you use in your organization who work with creating/editing competencies can still see the competencies. The top tier competency is the only one you would need to change (I know, easy to say I have 100+ top tiers....).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assigning Competency Levels based on Quiz marks

You would also need to select at least one value as the default value. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competency not completing for learners
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Bob, I think I have found how competencies work. I tell you my configuration. 1) Do a backup of competiencies and delete all plans and competencies. 2) Import your framework or 3) Create your framework competencies. In scale, you must choose in default "competent" (or another positive scale), and in profiency, choose all possible values that the compency can get. For example, if you use the next scale: "not competent, in process, competent", you choose "competent" for default option (it means the value for activities that competencies are automatically completed when criterias are done) and you choose all options for profiency (it means values for activities that competiencies are manually completed). 4) Create a learning plan, add the competencies, add cohort. 5) In course, add competencies (the same of the learning plan). 6) Edit activities or quizzes and in competencies, add them and mark the option "Completed the competency". Now, if you want to check it, make this activity or quizz like a student. If the califcation is positive, the competency should be marked like "competent". You can view it in competencies tab. I think that the module can improve. I think competencies should be added in each question of the Q'bank. A quizz has a lot of questions and each question could work different competency. Now, I will investigate how competencies are completed when the competency has several activities. Regards. IMG

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competency not completing for learners
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for keeping poking at this with me Shirley! I've used Attach evidence in every activity, and set competency completion on course completion. This way (I presumed) the default proficiency from the scale would be grabbed on course completion (Achieved)  and then reviewing the evidence, we could apply a 'higher' proficiency upon review. And it's working in some places and not others. For example, I currently have several competencies on a learning plan that are configured. Two examples below: 18740: Quiz (Attach Evidence), Assignment (Attach Evidence), Assignment (Attach Evidence). Course Completion (Complete the competency) 29778: Assignment (Attach Evidence), Assignment (Attach Evidence), Quiz (Attach Evidence). Course Completion (Complete the competency) 18740 is working perfectly, 29778 is the one that is breaking. Both are supplying evidence as expected, but 29778 is not completing on course completion. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competency not completing for learners
ResponsesInList.Text: After much faffing around, something Shirley said in another post pointed me in the right direction. Somehow my scale had gotten set up in a way you shouldn't be able to do. This is what it should have been: However, whenever I tried to configure scale, this was completely empty and nothing I could do would save changes. It seemed to work because I could manually Rate a learning plan with this scale. Today I managed to get my DBA to check the database for me and we found numerous silly problems. There were two identical copies of this scale, one with an id of 2, the other 4 The framework was configured to use Scale 4, but using the scale values from scale 2. "Not yet achieved" was the default for scale 2, which I'm guessing is why that was coming through in the completed learning plans. Ugh. Im guessing it broke at some point on an upgrade. We've cleaned the database up and things are now working correctly again. Thanks for your help Shirley! Im gonna upvote your posts to check your scales as many times as I can, lol

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Activities for completing competencies
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello Shirley I use a scale with 5 levels: INSUFICIENTE, SUFICIENTE, BIEN, NOTABLE and SOBRESALIENTE. In a scale 0 to 10 points where 0 is the worst and 10 is the excelence, my scale is: Insuficiente =  0-4 points (it is not competent) Suficiente = 5 points (slightly competent) Bien = 6 points (competency is good) Notable = 7-8 points (competency is remarkable) Sobresaliente = 9-10 points (competency is excellent) I have marked "bien" in default and all except insuficiente in profiency I have seen your recommendations about competency's rules. Although it can work, I would have to design as many sub-competencies as questionnaries and tasks I have, giving a large of framework of competencies. I am physics and chemistry's teacher and my competencies are given by law, and they are a bit wide. For example, one says: the student must identify, understand and explain physiochemical phenomens using physical theories and laws. I have created several sub-competencies based in Bloom's taxonomy, but I don't create subcompetencies for each phenomenon of study, and this makes a large of framework. I think the solution is complicated. Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: upon activity/curse completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, please could someone explain to me what each option containing "upon activity/curse completion" means (Do nothing/Attach evidence/Submit for review/Complete competency)? Thank you very much. Best regards. Veronica.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: upon activity/curse completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Do nothing - the competency will not be awarded to the student. Attach evidence - the student or instructor must upload a file before the competency is awarded the student. Such as Certificate of completion for an external course. Submit for review - the instructor will manually award the competency if the student's work supports achievement. Complete Competency - the competency is automatically award to the student if the complete conditions for the activity are met. Such as the student has a passing grade for that activity.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: upon activity/curse completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Shirley, thank you very much for your point by point explanation. Best regards. Verónica.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Trả lời: Re: Competency and Parent rating not rated
ResponsesInList.Text: Competencies can or not = courses. If you use parent-child competencies, the Parent competency is a summary of all child competencies and not related to a course activity. Parent - 5th grade science - this is the outcome of child1-3 competencies. Not related to a course activity. child 1 - environmental science - related to a course activity. child 2 - chemistry - related to a course activity. child 3 - biology - related to a course activity. Can you provide the course activity view for the 5hr completion? Did you setup your scale for the 5hr course as Competency/not yet complete? If you setup the scale, but did not link it to that competency it is impossible to change after the competency is awarded to any student. Kind Regards Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Use competency without learning plan
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Esther, The competencies and learning plans in Moodle are very in-flexible and have not received an update in a very long time. If your use case does not require competencies, I would not start the practice. The Moodle concept is for an educational based system. The student has a learning plan for a Chemical Engineer needs these competencies to earn an Engineering degree. The student completes the course, earns the competency and they move on to the next course (competency. My use case is in the workplace setting, where my students have to annually requalify to specific competencies. Moodle's competencies and learning plans were not designed for my use case. The general concept is that each student should have a learning plan with the competencies they need to acquire for a specific skill/task/educational requirement. In your use case you have many students so setting up learning plans would be a major administrative task. Learning plans are used to provide the students with a "list" of what they need to achieve or to provide learning goals. Learning plans can also be used to display to auditors, or regulators. I use the plugin- Monitoring of Learning Plans for the excellent visual display. https://moodle.org/plugins/report_lpmonitointring Without learning plans this plugin cannot be used. In my use case, I created learning paths for groups of students based on the job position. Forklift Drivers must have competencies, A-Z and AA-BB. All students that are forklift drivers have the same learning plan - and then I can compare if all Forklift Drivers are competent and have obtained and retained the desired skill sets. For me the basic functionality needs a development refresh. 1. the UI for creating Competency Frameworks and Learning plan templates is very manual and prone to human error. Hundreds of clicks to setup a small learning plan with competencies and add students to learning plans. 2. No automation, no Moodle core delivered reporting. 3. The objects Competencies and Learning plans have no End Date field and therefore the administrative hoops I jump through to refresh the learning plans is an on-going challenge. 4. End Dates is Moodle do not have the same functionality as other LMS systems. End Date should in a relational database end the relationship between the objects. The objects Competency to Learning plan or student to learning plan in the current state "live on forever". These are some of the Moodle Trackers - please vote for items that would help your use case. MDL-69237 Link a competency to multiple learning plan templates MDL-62551 - Add a leading checkbox in every competency line in the add competency to course/learning plan template pages MDL-57749 - Allow moving a competency framework to a different category or site MDL-69063 - Turn off Request Review feature for competencies. MDL-59865 - Learning Plan Expiry MDL-66976 Competency tracker Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: 'block/lp:view' and setup instructions for Learning plan supervisor (system)
ResponsesInList.Text: Learning plan supervisor (system) setup instructions  on page >>> https://docs.moodle.org/400/en/Learning_plan_supervisor states to add block/lp:view to allow... * 5. Scroll down and set the capabilities moodle/site:configview, moodle/competency:templatemanage, moodle/competency:templateview and block/lp:view all to Allow. However, I do not have such a capability in my 4.06 moodle.  Upon further research, I found that, apparently, block/lp:view was removed in 2018 for Moodle3.53/3.6, and "fixed" in version 3.7 >>> https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-64124 Question , is this my ID10T error, or is this capability deprecated?  If deprecated, what should be the correct instructions for creating a Learning plan supervisor (system)? Thanks in advance... Best regards, Shemp *Learning plan supervisor (system) From Site administration, access the Define Roles screen and click the button to Add a new role. Click the Continue button. Give your role the name Learning plan supervisor (system) Tick 'System' as the context type where the role may be assigned. * Scroll down and set the capabilities moodle/site:configview, moodle/competency:templatemanage, moodle/competency:templateview and block/lp:view all to Allow. Save the new role.

In Moodle Tracker consider voting for issues that you believe have value to fixing the Learning Plan/Competency shortcomings. MDL-69237 Link a competency to multiple learning plan templates MDL-62551 - Add a leading checkbox in every competency line in the add competency to course/learning plan template pages MDL-57749 - Allow moving a competency framework to a different category or site MDL-69063 - Turn off Request Review feature for competencies MDL-59865 - Learning Plan Expiry MDL-37931 - Grades Overview Report (the last one is not for LPs, but I still believe it has merit) Additionally, the forum where discussions regard LP/Competency might get some traction is the Moodle UX discussions https://moodle.org/mod/forum/view.php?id=8698 forum. Kind Regards, Shirley

ResponsesInList.Title: Parent Competency Not Completing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have a parent competency that is not updating as complete within a course, even though the children competencies are marked "Competent". Here's what I have done: I created a Competency Framework based on Bloom's Taxonomy. The parent competency is called "Bloom's Taxonomy Completion" and the children competencies are named after the six levels of Bloom's Taxonomy. I created a Competency rule that says the Parent Competency is complete when all the children competencies are complete. I then added all 7 competencies to a test course (1 parent and 6 children) I then created 6 activities and aligned one of each of the 6 children competencies to one of each activity.  (Remember competency to Remember activity, Understand competency to understand activity, etc.) I enrolled a student account (myself) into the course. I entered the course and completed all 6 activities.  (NOTE:  I did this AFTER all the competencies were added to the course and AFTER all the activities were linked to the 6 children competencies) After completing all 6 activities, I went to the Competencies section of the course. (Still in the role of a student).  There, I could see that the course was telling me that I was competent in all 6 children competencies, but I still lacked the parent competency (Bloom's Taxonomy Completion) and was therefore only proficient in 6 out of 7 competencies within the course. I logged out as a student and logged back in as an administrator. Going to the course, I went to Reports and Competency Breakdown.  There, I could see that the student (aka myself) had been rated "Competent" in all 6 children competencies, but had not yet been rated in the Parent Competency. Looking at the Competency Breakdown in more detail, each of the children competencies had "Proficient" and the related activity listed as Evidence for its "Competent" rating.  However, the Parent Competency had "No" for its proficiency and NO EVIDENCE to support it. My question is, "Why did the Parent Competency within the course not automatically display as 'Competent' and 'Proficient' when the 6 sub-competencies (children) successfully marked themselves 'Competent' after the linked activities were completed?" You should also know that I have reviewed these previous forum posts and believe that none of them answer my question: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=420205 https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=392208#p1581515 (The children ratings in my case were not retroactive.) https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=381913#p1540201 (I believe I created the Competency Rule correctly - see previous image) Thanks in advance. Ringocase

ResponsesInList.Title: award competency only after competion of multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Moodle community, I am quite new to Moodle, so I hope you can help me clarify a few thing. To give you an idea, what I am working on: We are trying to build an online learning tool for handball referees. Our idea is to have separate learning plans (LP)  for different leagues: referee - elite level referee - adults referee - juniors On the next level, we plan to have competencies (C) for different aspects of being a referee: understanding of handball - elite level leadership - elite level organisation and rules - elite level understanding of handball - adults leadership - adults organisation and rules - adults ... and so on ... And on the bottom level, we would like to have multiple courses, e.g. - understanding of handball - elite level group tactics - elite level offense - elite level defense - elite level ... and so on ... Our idea is that after completing the 3 courses (group tactics, offense, defense), the referee is awarded the competency of "understanding handball - elite level". And after gaining all the elite level competencies, the elite level learning plan is fulfilled and the referee can lead games on that level. However, we don't manage to get it work like this. As soon as one course is completed, the competency is awarded. I found these two forum threads: 1) https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=392070 2) https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=365575 Here, it sounds like this is not possible ("each lesson may have 15-20 competencies"). On the other hand, the Moodle FAQ says "Can a competency be added to more than one course or activity? Definitely - and your organisation might well need to do this, if certain competencies need to be met in a series of courses or several activities within one course. " This sounds like what we imagined. Now the question is: Is this possible? If so, which settings do we have to set to accomplish this? Or do we need to add (child) competencies for each course and parent competencies for our planned competencies (understanding of handball, leadership, etc.)? Many thanks for your help already in advance. I hope I have explained everything in sufficient detail that you can imagine what we are trying to do.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: award competency only after competion of multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: If you use the restrict access condition on your courses, so that the students must complete all courses in sequence, the competencies can be awarded on the last completed courses. Or they can be award in phases, Courses 1-3 award competencies A and B, Courses 4-6 award competencies C and D, and the last courses 7-9 award the final competencies E and F. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Question about the competency scale and how to set it to get automatically approved competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have a problem with understanding the proficiency/competent scale in competency frameworks. May I kindly ask you for some assist here? I read already the documentation ( https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Competency_frameworks ) and FAQ about it; I found here couple of threads about the same topic as well (e.g. https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=355311 which looks the nearest to my case). In each case the answers are linked to proper setup of the competency scale (Default and Proficient values). But I'm missing something and to be honest I don't know what. Maybe I provide some background and my example: I set my newly created competency framework and I decided to use default competency scale (and I set both Default and Proficient values to Competent); competencies on "level 2" are needed to be closed to get "Level 1" competencies. Each competency is linked to the activity with "upon activity completion: complete the competency". Moreover the course is set so that "Upon course completion: complete the competency" (the course is based on self-learning activities and self-studying resources; I would like to minimize the need of teacher assistance and give the possibility that students go through the whole course and close it with the success even when they forget to mark one of the checkbox next to the activity). To simplify that and make it an example out of my case, let's assume that I added only one resource to the course: an URL (with an activity completion via manual marking; and it is linked with a competency). It can be marked by a student as done or (alternatively) he/she can simply press "complete the course" in the "Self completion" block. In both cases the student completed the course and he/she will be seen as "Competent" one in the Learning Plan. But he/she is still not Proficient, the teacher needs to rate it (and can be requested to do a review). Is it possible to skip this manual step of a teacher? I have another case in my mind: if a teacher needs to close manually the course for the student as some kind of the 2nd gate (e.g. the course has two conditions for the course completion: the student needs to work on activities/resources and mark it "done" and in "manual completion by others" the teacher is marked as a mandatory) it is rather duplicate action to rate the competency rated with the course, or I'm wrong? I know that the teacher and Learning Plan supervisor aren't always the same person, but in case of yes, how to simplify the process? I think that I can't be the first one with such question, right? Maybe I can't use a standard competency scale, or some types of activities/resources? Would someone be so kind to help me out? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Question about the competency scale and how to set it to get automatically approved competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: If you use a simple scale. Proficient, Not Yet Proficient and set the default to Proficient for the competency. Add the competency to the course activity and for the Upon activity completion value - only use Complete the competency if you want to automatically award the competency. All other options require manually intervention by an administrator/instructor. I only place the course competencies on one course activity. 99% of which is after successful completion of the quiz. Some of my courses award multiple competencies. Only use manually rating (or complex scales) if your administrators/instructors will agree to the manual process and they require the level of granularly in reporting competencies earned by earn student. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Question about the competency scale and how to set it to get automatically approved competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Shirley, as mentioned in my other thread: I'm coming back here as well with a "big thank you" on my lips To the point: I finally get it! I'm not sure why it wasn't working previously, as I had my competency scale like on the picture below : Maybe it was linked with my approach that I created one of the Learning Plan, I ascribed it to a student, and later I started the changes in the scale; maybe the LP or scale wasn't changed simultaneously everywhere, or such updates were disabled by purpose. No idea, but what is the most important is that I have the problem solved. Btw . my original understanding was that it will be possible to set the course in that way, that all competencies will be set as "gained" after completing of the whole course without marking of each one of activities/resources as done (no matter if by self or automatic marking). In my opinion it would be great to get the competencies with the "self completion" block as well (without additional activity for the teacher/supervisor). I know how to set the course to be closed by both options (Course conditional completion in which I can set "any of conditions are met"; one condition can be "activity completion" and other "manual self completion" (or "manual ... by others"), but it is not working with the competencies. Or am I missing again some points in the settings? Your comments will be well appreciated cheers!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Question about the competency scale and how to set it to get automatically approved competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: 99% of my competencies are added to the final quiz activity, with a passing grade which is required for course completion. The quiz activity also has Restrict access conditions - all activities must be completed before the quiz is available to the student. The Competency is added to the Course competencies and the Upon activity completion = complete the competency. If you setup you courses and competencies as I have described - the other thing to look at is your Cron job, Complete learning plans which are due. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: What function does the 'Comment on a user competency" relate to?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, On behalf of an institution (using Moodle 3.10.6) who are reviewing and testing various site-wide notifications and permissions, I am currently attempting to understand and provide an answer to them on what the 'Comment on a user competency' ( moodle/competency:usercompetencycomment) role capability permission actually relates to within the user interface. When editing a role's permissions, it is grouped under the "User" context .  According to this resource it is defaulted to only be enabled for the Manager role archetype. I would presume then that whatever this "comment" function is, it would be accessible at a system or category level. When setting up the competency framework, adding the competencies to said framework, editing either, applying a specific competency to a course etc. I cannot find anywhere that gives you the option to comment on it. If you attach the competency to a learning plan and apply that plan to a user, you can comment on the plan when viewing a user's profile. This seems to be the only place I have seen (beyond rating an activity for competency) that you can comment on anything related to a competency: This doesn't seem like the function that competency comment permission relates to. This comment function within the user profile  has its own role capability permission Comment on a learning plan moodle/competency:plancomment. I would normally be viewing in the Boost theme but switched to Classic just to ensure nothing funky was going on visibility wise (spurred on by the issues viewing admin options to add Comptencies/Learning Plans at a category level mentioned in https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-64795 ). Just thought i'd mention that. Not sure if it is a lack of clarity around the description of this permission or just user error/oversight/inexperience (take your pick) but any help with this would be amazing! Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: What function does the 'Comment on a user competency" relate to?
ResponsesInList.Text: Alex, Actually, this capability applies only to the USER context , not to system or category (as defined in /lib/db/access.php). There's an explanation for how this is used in this tracker https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-55498 and how to set it up to use is shown in the documentation for the Learning Plan Supervisor role . Basically, this capability is needed to make comments on a specific user in the plan since the plan may be at the system or category level, but the comments on a specific competency for a specific user belong at the user level. (Think of it like badges, for example.) It's the complement of the capability moodle/competency:usercompetencycommentown that users have for themselves.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: What function does the 'Comment on a user competency" relate to?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Randy, Thanks for taking the time to respond. Greatly appreciated. Thanks for the clarification. It makes sense thinking about it now Cheers, Alex

ResponsesInList.Title: Competencies and/ or Learning Plan?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, am just starting to use the Competency and Learning Plan and would need advice on best practices The main gist is that we want to have something like a report card at the end of the semester for the student, with a few competencies with a scale of "good", "proficient" for each competency etc 1. Is it OK to use the competency framework without using a learning plan? For example, I can add competencies to a course. Then link those competencies in a quiz, or graded assignment, is this a common approach? From student's perspective, when they go to the "Competencies" section, then they should see what competencies they are proficient in. I have not fully tested this out, but it seems to be possible. 2. Or should I be creating individual learning plans for each student to be graded for each competency I understand we can use cohort sync to assign learning plans for the entire cohort. However, it seems that that grading has to be requested from the student. Is there a way that teachers can review the competency at a certain time and manually input the grading scale for the students without getting students to request? 3. Is it possible to manually grade students for competencies? Understand that a better way is to use assignments or activities to track completion status. However, we are just starting to use Moodle, so many of our assignments, quizzes etc are not in the moodle system yet (could be paper form, or in other electronic form), so it will take some time to import all assignments into Moodle. Before we get to the state where everything is handled in moodle, is there a way to manually and easily assign the competency grade to the students? Thanks, David

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies and/ or Learning Plan?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello David, 1. Competencies must have a relationship to a student's Learning Plan in order to display the student's competencies. The object being viewed is the Student's Learning Plan. 2. Normally, you create a Learning Plan Template and then add in all of the competencies for that learning plan. Each student may have a unique learning plan template or you could create learning plan templates that are common goals that all students in that area of study must achieve. 2a. Cohort Sync to learning plans will automatically link student's that are members of a cohort to a specific learning plan. Cohorts are mainly used to automate course enrollments. 2b. When a competency is related to a course activity the administrator can choose to either automatically award the competency to the student or have the activity manually rated by a teacher. The student will not be awarded the competency until the teacher rates it. I would only recommend manual rating for Essay or complex assignments. 3. Competencies are not grades. Competencies are an alternate method of tracking achievement. Please note the core Moodle structure does not have standard reports on Learning plans and student competencies. The UI for working with competencies and learning plans frameworks are very unforgiving. There are many past post in the forum that you could poke around and look at to provide you with a sense of the challenges if you decide to use competencies and learning plans.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies and/ or Learning Plan?
ResponsesInList.Text: To address number 1) "Is it OK to use the competency framework without using a learning plan?" The answer is yes, if what you are primarily interested in is course alignment with standards for use in reporting, course design, accreditation, etc. Course competency frameworks are a very valuable source of information for helping with course design and standards alignment all in itself. For some institutions, this is all that what they currently need and may not yet be focused on or desirous of implementing the Learning Plans: they are focused on the course design phase. Also, I have seen a definite benefit in cases where an organization may not have experience with competency based learning models: they can use the frameworks to understand how those work. It is very valuable as the first step if you are not used to working in a competency based model. You can always progress later to add Learning Plans: but if you don't have the right set up for your frameworks to start with, and sufficiently well designed courses that align to the standards, it will probably be a less effective (and more confusing) if you rush into it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies and/ or Learning Plan?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Randy, Shirley Thank you very much for your response To test this out, I have added some competencies to a course and tagged an assignment activity to these competencies with the option "Send for review" upon activity completion. When I log in as a student, on the Student View > Competencies, there is a "You are proficient in 0 out of 8 competencies in this course" message. However, after the student has submitted the assignment, and received a grade, the above is still 0 out of 8. What does the student need to do to have the proficiency tagged as 8 out of 8 proficiencies?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies and/ or Learning Plan?
ResponsesInList.Text: [EDIT] I figured out how to change the proficiency here, just to share, hopefully, it helps somebody else figuring out this issue down the road In the Course > Edit Settings > More > Reports > Competency Breakdown There is a screen where all the competencies are listed, and you can Rate each student's competency based on the pre-defined scale. When this is updated, from the student view, when they view competency, the status will change. This fits my current scenario where my assignments etc are not fully configured for competency ratings yet, as it gives us a way to rate the child's competency manually at the end of each semester.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies and/ or Learning Plan?
ResponsesInList.Text: Excellent that works for your use case. I do not use the Competency Breakdown report , as it has limited functionality. My students need to see their entire Learning Plan and their current progress. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Adding new learner to existing Learning Plan cohort
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a cohort that is synced with a learning plan and a supervisor is assigned to the cohort.  I have a new student that I want to assign to that learning plan supervisor.  I can add the user to the existing cohort.  However, when I go to learning plan templates to sync the cohort with the learning plan, the cohort already exists.  How do I then perform the sync?  Do I delete the current cohort and then sync it again?  By doing that I'm not affecting the learning plans of the other students?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding new learner to existing Learning Plan cohort
ResponsesInList.Text: Do no delete the current cohort. There is a Cron job, Cohort enrolment sync task that runs the sync, is may not be running as often as needed. You can select the run now to have it update the cohort syncs.

ResponsesInList.Text: Create the competency with normal language and in the description of the competency use the symbols and math notations. Competency ID = Math Level 1 Description = Students that achieve this competency must understand the math function (𝑥+𝑎)^𝑛=∑24_(𝑘=0)^𝑛〖(𝑛¦𝑘) 𝑥^𝑘 𝑎^(𝑛−𝑘) 〗

ResponsesInList.Title: Competencies: Less work for teachers?
ResponsesInList.Text: As far as my understanding goes: At the moment you can use competencies in Moodle as a teacher by doing a lot by hand. But I would like most of this work to be automated. So here is what I am looking for. According to local requirements, we have to rate competencies at four levels - which is not a problem to set up. However, in our courses we use a lot of automatically graded activities (or even assignments). But at the moment I don't see any way how I can automatically assign a student a high level of competency who has done very well in one of these activities, and a low level of competency to a student who has done less well. Doing that by hand is not only tedious (you don't see the points of an assignment or quiz in the competency overview, but also prone to error. And I don't really see the point of copying/replicating digitally available information by hand within the same system. The second problem I have: Some acitivities (rich in pedagogical content) are linked to several competencies, but as far as I see I can't award one of several competencies automatically whereas another one is just used as reverance. All these problems are in stark contrast to the fine grained possibilities when restricting activities depending on prior achievements Moodle already provides. That's why I want to ask whether there ary any plans to make the whole compentency framework more flexible? That would certainly save teachers a lot of time and frustration with teadious paper work. In case my conception of the possibilities and limitations of competencies are wrong, I'm more than happy to stand corrected.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies vs Activity Completion

It is a necessary evil, for what I need to track - if it was not a requirement - I would just use the activity completion and Grades reports to evaluate if the training objectives were met. Within this forum - you can find some good data to support not going down that path. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: All user's competency SQL

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: All user's competency SQL
ResponsesInList.Text: This got my results closer to what you described, However, for me it is returning rows of Competency that are not visible. I need a where clause to exclude them to make this even better - it escapes me just now. SELECT distinct user.firstname AS Firstname, user.lastname AS Lastname, user.email AS Email, comp.shortname AS 'Competency', CASE WHEN cuc.grade = 2 THEN 'yes' WHEN cuc.grade = 1 THEN 'no' ELSE '-' end as "grade" FROM prefix_competency_usercomp AS cuc INNER JOIN prefix_user AS user ON cuc.userid = user.id INNER JOIN prefix_competency AS comp ON cuc.competencyid = comp.id AND user.deleted = 0 AND user.suspended = 0 ORDER BY email

ResponsesInList.Title: Edit a Competency Framework - scales
ResponsesInList.Text: Having created a number of frameworks and then allocated them to learning plans and allocated students to the learning plans I have been asked to adjust the scales linked to the frameworks. The problem is that when I edit the Framework and select the new Scale and configure the appropriate Default and Proficient options, I click Save Changes but get the error "The scale needs to be configured by selecting default and proficient items"? Is it not possible to change the scale of a framework once it has been created? I thought it may be because learners were allocated to the associated learning plan however I have tested it with a framework that has no learning plans against it and get the same error occurs? We are using Moodle 3.9.2+ and any advice would be gratefully received. Many thanks Andrew

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Edit a Competency Framework - scales
ResponsesInList.Text: You cannot change the scales after a competency has been awarded to a student. There is no forgiveness, if you setup scales that you do not like. In your additional testing, was the competency awarded to a student ever? Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Edit a Competency Framework - scales
ResponsesInList.Text: i had the same problem. I cannot edit framework. As i unterstood, you can add new scale only to the new framework.

ResponsesInList.Title: Multiple activities lead to competence
ResponsesInList.Text: I've been looking for an answer for ages, so I hope I haven't overlooked something obvious. So far, all the workarounds I have found assume a fairly traditional approach to course design and learning, ironically. For example, they suggest hiding an activity until the other activities have been completed. The course I am designing will be self-paced, self-study. As a result, I cannot assume or impose a sequence for completing activities, nor hide any until others are completed. There is usually no hierarchy between the activities relating to a competency. What I would like to do is have a person marked as competent when all activities where that competency has been allocated have been completed. At the moment, I am thinking that the only way is for it to be done manually, but that seems strange for what must be a pretty common situation. Am I missing something? Any pointers gratefully received.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities lead to competence
ResponsesInList.Text: That functionality does not currently exist. It could be that the Badge object fulfills that functionality, I do not use them. I also think the functionality to have and either/or option is needed. You can complete this set of activities (or course) or this set of activities (or course) to earn a competency. Your use case has merit, you should consider creating a tracker. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities lead to competence
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for your response and at least there is a clear answer! I very much agree that there needs to be an either/or aspect to competencies. I am not criticising that part of the industry, but Moodle often seems to be developed only with an eye on traditional uses such as schools and colleges and fails to take account of professional development, for example. As I hinted at in my original post, I find myself smiling sometimes that It feels very old-school in its approach.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities lead to competence
ResponsesInList.Text: BTW - I don't know what a tracker is!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities lead to competence
ResponsesInList.Text: https://tracker.moodle.org You will need to create an account. I often search if there issues has already been recorded or if a new tracker should be created. To create a new issue there are some prerequisites to ensure the post is not a robot. There was an great explanation of the process, that I believe Mary Cooch posted but I have been unable to locate that post. This is one I created - If you have large populations of students (employees) with a few students in each learning plan is it challenging to administrate. Please vote for this tracker issue if you plan on managing large groups of competencies and learning plans - MDL-69237 Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities lead to competence
ResponsesInList.Text: Up front, competencies are not an area I've done a lot of work with, but this kind of approach is certainly possible with activity restrictions and completions, and therefore should be available for competencies Make all of the activities have completion tracking for whatever they need to be judged complete, then make a single activity, even a label, with activity restrictions based on: has completed activity1 AND has completed activity2 AND ... You can then set that final activity as complete when viewed and base anything else that needs to have a single activity completion as its rule on that.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities lead to competence
ResponsesInList.Text: This method would be a solution, but the solution is limited to activities within the same course. If a student needed to complete multiple activities in different courses the activity restriction setup may/or may not work as expected. In general, the competencies and learning plans are not a mature as other functionality within Moodle. Many LMS have the competencies with expiration dates that trigger annual recertification. Moodle competencies are earned and never expire. The competency object has no end date. Yes, they can be deleted, but that the student's history of holding that competency for a period of time is not available for auditors. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities lead to competence
ResponsesInList.Text: For time limited certifications like that, you may need to look into Moodle Workplace, which does have those features.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities lead to competence
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Craig, Your post highlighted an issue with my installation that just took a couple of hours to sort out! So, thanks, I think! I suspect you might get more informed information from a new post, but I had a look at this on my site. First of all, you need to have allocated all the competencies you want to use to the course. This means, as far as I can see, expanding all the sub-competencies, highlighting them all and then adding them to the course. I used a book activity, went to edit settings and then down the bottom to competencies. There I was able to click on the little down arrow and then allowed me to select any competency or sub-competency. It didn't have a competency setting at the chapter level though. I was able to do the same with a quiz as well. Hopefully that was what you were asking. I found this page very useful: https://docs.moodle.org/310/en/Competencies

I wouldn't want to make a participant go to a specific activity last just to trigger the completion, because a) I don't think it looks very good, and b) that assumes the participant knows that they have completed all the necessary activities.

ResponsesInList.Title: Set up custom levels
ResponsesInList.Text: I want to create custom levels for a competency framework - I have done this before so know it is possible but cannot now figure out how to do it. I want to do the following: Domains Standards Competencies Levels I cannot see how I can create a new level so it shows up when I set up a competency framework. Can anyone give me some guidance on where I can edit the levels within a competency framework to be the language that I want to use? It is the taxonomies that I want to customize and I cannot see where to do this. Thanks, Nikki

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Set up custom levels
ResponsesInList.Text: Nikki, This is done in the Settings for each Framework, so Site admin > Competencies > Competency frameworks, then choose Edit for the framework you want and set those in the Taxonomies section. If you want to change the actual terminology of some of those levels, because you have a term or terms that are not on the list, you can do that using the Language Customisation tool ( https://docs.moodle.org/310/en/Language_customisation ). All of those terms for the taxonomy levels can be changed there. Search in the tool where the "Show strings from" is set to competency.php and then look for the string identifiers with names like "taxonomy_" such as "taxonomy_skill" and so forth and then put in your desire term there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Set up custom levels
ResponsesInList.Text: Ah, so you want to increase the number of levels from four to a higher number? I'm not sure this is possible without changing code? While there are 11 possible levels, the limit of 4 on the page is set by the code (in admin/tool/lp/classes/form/competencyframework.php (line 104 in 3.10) or less depending on whether you set less. The limit seems a bit arbitrary since the code seems that it was written to handle more levels if needed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Set up custom levels

More than 11 levels will definitely break, but 5 seems to work (which it should according to the code.) It would be nice if this was setting for Site admins to set or perhaps even a variable in the code, but so it is.

ResponsesInList.Title: Activities-competencies relationship
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, where can I find the relationship between competencies and activities in the database ? When you assign a competency to an activity, that information must be stored in a DB table I presume, but I can't find it. It looks like the relationship for course and competencies is in the table competency_coursecomp and competency_usercompcourse, but, again, i cannot find the relation like between activity and competency. Any help would be much appreciated.
role: Picture of Luis de la Torre

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Activities-competencies relationship
ResponsesInList.Text: Luis, You will find this in the table mdl_competency_modulecomp. The column cmid holds the id of the activity module in the mdl_course modules table, while the column comptencyid hold the particular competency id linking to the main mdl_competency table. That is how they are connected. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Using Quiz & Competencies to Unlock Assignments
ResponsesInList.Text: Not sure if this is possible or has been thought about. I am working on building curriculum materials for wilderness medicine courses. To maintain a certification the student has to return within three years and take a recertification class. I would like to build a pre-assessment quiz that gets linked to competencies. If the student gets a question or series of questions wrong (a.k.a. not meeting a competency), I would like it to result in unlocking the corresponding activity for review. I realize that the instructor can do this manually based on results, but the majority will not do this. I am trying to create a course template that is mostly hands off and automated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Quiz & Competencies to Unlock Assignments
ResponsesInList.Text: Brigitte, So, two things: 1) competencies are not a trigger, but they depend on a trigger, activity completion: so you use the activity that triggers the competency to trigger further content using access restrictions; and 2) competencies can only apply to a whole quiz not to questions. A Competency is awarded based on some activity completion or not. So, you can't award it based on sets of questions in a quiz, you would have to use a separate quiz for each competency to award it or not. Currently in Moodle you can't link a competency directly to a particular question or set of questions, only to any activity as a whole (Cf. this discussion https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=402469 ). Maybe one day we will have that, but meanwhile you need to align to a whole quiz. That being so, you need multiple quizzes if you want to award multiple competencies. You then use the grades from those quizzes with Access restrictions for further grant access to specific review content. Access restrictions can be set for a grade range. (cf. https://docs.moodle.org/310/en/Restrict_access_settings ). For example, if the person got 90% or a passing grade on a quiz, then award then competency; if they got 75-90, open a review section further down the course; if they got below 75, open a section with note saying sorry and a link to take the refresher course instead ;) Btw , are you affiliated with NOLS? I did the NOLS Wilderness Medicine course about five years ago. I think I need a refresher ;)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Quiz & Competencies to Unlock Assignments
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Randy, Thank you for the reply. I suspected this. I will have to think about how to use quizzes in a manner that is effective. Would be great to have it linked to questions down the line. I appreciate the complexities of trying to code a system that does this and understand that it is likely not an easy task. I am very grateful for the many tools we do have in Moodle and learn more and more each day how to use them. Been a fun journey. I am affiliated with NOLS, but not on the wilderness medicine side. I teach backpacking, mountaineering, and sea kayaking courses for NOLS. However, the wilderness medicine curriculum I teach is through Wilderness Medical Associates, International. If you are out West, the Eastern Sierra is a great place to take a course and refresh skills. Thanks again for your reply. Brigitte

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using Quiz & Competencies to Unlock Assignments
ResponsesInList.Text: Brigette, The good news is access restrictions in Moodle are pretty powerful, especially with the various plugins that are available to extend it ( https://moodle.org/plugins/?q=type:availability ). You can build some complex structures and content paths with them. Unfortunately, Competencies has been mostly relegated to "oh, we have that too" feature list and has been really lacking in feature development. Sometimes the best way to get something done is just abandon formal competencies and go with activity completions and badges and/or certificates instead. Even in those cases, though, there can be value for at least aligning all your activities to competencies. You can use Tags for Questions, if your main interest is in analysis and reporting. I've been in two projects to do this: basically, you tag your questions with tags that duplicate your competency structures, which allows you to see what is going on at least. That can improve your course design and assessments. It won't it help you or students at all in awarding competencies directly though. I love the eastern Sierra. I'm from Oregon but am currently in southern Rockies - I live right on the CDT Hope to get back out there soon for sure.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competency Bird-Eye view for HR
ResponsesInList.Text: I use this plugin-in Monitoring of Learning Plans. https://moodle.org/plugins/report_lpmonitointring Excellent visualization of the learning plan. Unfortunately, there are no Moodle core reports on anything to support learning plans, competency frameworks or learning plan templates. There is no way to report on all students with a single competency. If you have large populations of students (employees) with a few students in each learning plan is it challenging to administrate. Please vote for this tracker issue if you plan on managing large groups of competencies and learning plans - MDL-69237

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competency Bird-Eye view for HR
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, we're still in the planning stage so i'd love to hear some suggestions! If i understood you correctly, your opinion is that my needs would be better served with just using courses? So basically, i would create a course instead of a learning plan, in which the student gets 'trained' in a particular job role? In this way, would HR be able to have a user that will 'see' all the courses completed by the student (and possibly, what grade?) Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competency Bird-Eye view for HR
ResponsesInList.Text: Learning plan 10,000 ft view 1. Competencies are created in the competency framework 2. Learning plan template are created with the desired competencies. 3. Student are assigned a learning plan which becomes their learning plan 4. Course are created that award the competency at a course activity. These are designed to be viewed by the student/Employee - it may be possible to allow manager/instructors to see this view but this takes changes to roles/permissions. Moodle core has no manager, instructor view - I use the plugin I mentioned above to achieve this. Courses - a. Courses contain content and/or activities that students (employees) must complete. You can set passing conditions such as a grade. b.Moodle has standardized core reports for course activity completion and course completion. c. All students who are enrolled in the course - current status and date they achieved the completion status. d. Students who successfully complete a course can achieve the competency which can be rated (automatic or manually). You should research some of the posting in this forum to see the issues that have come up - You should research the available Moodle documentation for competencies, learning plans, scales Maybe start here - https://docs.moodle.org/310/en/Competencies

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies not updating based on quiz completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Additionally, if the student does not complete/pass the quiz the competency in the student's learning plan will be displayed as Not Yet Rated. There is no value is creating the incomplete scale value as the default value, because you will need to manual update all students who completed/pass the quiz. This would be extremely labor intensive. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies not updating based on quiz completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes!  So, in the scales configuration "default" means this is the automatic result when a student successfully completes a competency.  And "proficiency" means items that can be rated manually by someone supervising the student's completion of a competency. Thus, if I want students to be rated by a supervisor as either complete or incomplete both of those items would be selected under proficiency, and if I want a student to have a competency automatically marked as complete when they have finished the competency then that is the default. Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies not updating based on quiz completion
ResponsesInList.Text: At the course activity the Default value kicks in automatically if the activity that grants the Competency = Complete the competency. The other course activity condition - is manual - This is when you want the instructor/teacher to rate each student's competency - This would be used if you had an essay or a task that the student has to be observed....and there could be scale values of; Good, Superior, Expert to choose from. Proficiency is displayed on the competency within the student's learning plan. It is Proficient or not Proficient - any or all of your scale values can be deemed as proficient. I have Completed and excused/exempt in many of my competency scales. Both are proficient, but only Completed is the default value. I sometimes need to manually excuse/exempt a student from an activity. Kind regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies not updating based on quiz completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Steven, exactly so. This terminology is so confusing to most people that I change it in the language strings to "Automatically awarded" and "Manually awarded". If some people are used to the technical terms, I will put "Automatically awarded (default)" etc. If you are not familiar with the Language customization tool, here is the documentation on how to use it . There are four strings I usually change: Component: tool_ip.php String identifiers: default, proficient, scale_help Component: core_competency.php String identifier: errorscaleconfiguration Most of the other appearances of the word "proficient" make sense to those not used to competencies, so I usually leave those as is.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies not updating based on quiz completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Woo hoo!  What a great tool.  Thank you Randy.  I hope the language customization tool works with other components as well.  "Evidence of prior learning" drives people insane.  It should just be "evidence of learning." 😀

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies not updating based on quiz completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Steven, Ah, "prior" learning. Yes! The language customization tool works with everything: any string that appears in the Moodle interface, including any additional plugins you add, will be in that found in that tool and can be changed. If you have any questions on its use, the best place to check is in the Languages forum: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/view.php?id=43 .

ResponsesInList.Title: Request: Override main taxonomy at item level
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello to you all, Just to report the difficulties met when using the competency tools with french official competency frameworks (happy if someone has a solution) Different depths The official program board publishes the list of competencies but organized at different levels of the taxonomy: Domain Competencies Domain Domain Competencies Domain Domain Domain Competencies It means that when creating it in moodle, I need to create "fake" empty levels, to stay tuned with the taxonomy: Domain - Domain - Domain - Competency Domain Detail Detail Competencies Domain Domain Detail Competencies Domain Domain Domain Competencies This solution is really artificial. Different types at same level Moreover, the official program are organized with Competencies AND Associated Knowledge at the same level. Domain Domain Domain Competencies Knowledges PROPOSITION I would propose, as an evolution of the mdl_competency table, to have a column taxonomy_override to add the type of the item: domain, knowledge, concept, value... Exemple of a french program for audit and accounting: https://cache.media.enseignementsup-recherche.gouv.fr/file/25/01/5/ensup135_annexe1_1142015.pdf You can vote for the request in tracker https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-70652 Cheers François

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to use taxonomy levels effectively?

ResponsesInList.Title: Best strategy for competency/learning plan setup
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, Very new to Moodle, but not new to LMS. When we get a new employee, I want to assign them something like a learning plan so they are batch enrolled in all the courses in the learning plan. First of all, is this how learning plans work? Creating learning plans requires creating competencies first, but I not sure how to organize the competencies. Here is the idea, tell me how I should configure this in Moodle. I really appreciate your help! For example, I have dinner chefs and bakers. Both jobs require Food Safety training. Only Chefs need Chicken Training. Only bakers need Frosting Training.  Chefs require Basic Oven training. Bakers require Advanced Oven training. Competency Framework: Oven Competencies: Basic Oven, Advanced Oven Competency Framework: Food Safety Competencies: Clean surfaces, Safe Temperature Competency Framework: Chicken Competencies: Deboning, Marinating Competency Framework: Frosting Competencies: Mixing, Spreading Learning Plan: Chef Competencies: all in frameworks Food Safety, Chicken, Advanced Oven Chef is assigned the Chef Learning plan, which enrolls her in all courses marked with the competencies Food Safety, Chicken, and Basic Oven. Learning Plan: Baker Competencies: all in frameworks Food Safety, Frosting, Advanced Oven Baker is assigned the Baker learning plan, which enrolls her in all courses marked with competencies Food Safety, Frosting, and Advanced Oven. Am I on the right track?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Best strategy for competency/learning plan setup
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tennille, Competency Based Training as you explained needs to be made more task related and specific. Competency :-Basic Oven is insufficient as it would not allow the proper assessment. A simple approach can be to divide the task into three i.e. the pre activities , the activity and the post activity. What are the skills required for the task that relates  to the oven? Identify these in order. An oven is useful for baking or broiling:- Possible Pre-task:- Appropriate preparation of the oven:- 1. check the oven shelves (this determines quality) 2. presetting of the temperature gauge. 3. appropriate setting of the temperature gauge. (The difference between 2 and 3 is that it can be set but it was too high or too low.) Task:- 4. Proper placing of the chicken in the oven (for proper circulation of heat) 5. Sufficient baking time 6. Checking of product during baking. Post task:- 7 Turning oven off 8. Placing product in an appropriate place Check online, help can be found there. "Type competencies training  for bakers". I hope that you would be able to set up your plan. Best of luck Jemima

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Best strategy for competency/learning plan setup
ResponsesInList.Text: Competency Frameworks do not have to mirror your Learning Plans Template (Framework). Competencies from any framework can be added to a Learning Plan Template. You could have one large framework or hundreds. Note: once you setup a framework you cannot move the competency to another framework. Consider how your administrators will use these objects before you setup your framework(s). If you have one large framework, you can relocate a competency within the single framework. IMHO - I would create Food Safety as the top, Parent. I would create under Food, Chicken, Frosting, Chef, Baker. Under Chicken - deboning, Marinating. Before you can build your competencies frameworks, you have to consider scales. Scales cannot be changes once a student (employee) has been awarded the competency. We are using the Monitoring of Learning Plans plugin, which is more visual than the core design. Consider how you will use the competencies and learning plans. For Food Safety each employee will probably have to requalify annually or bi-annually. The competency objects have no end date, they never expire. Learning plans assigned to employees have no end-dates, they never expire. Deleting them removes the training history that you will need to retain for FDA. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Demonstrating proficiency
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I am experimenting with Competencies, as I would like to set up an IB ATL Skills framework. I adapted one Competency Framework from the Repository -the CFER provided by Mary Cooch- for the purpose. The scale values were: "Not yet competent" and "competent" . The scale configuration was: [{"scaleid":"7"},{"id":2,"scaledefault":1,"proficient":1},{"id":3,"scaledefault":0,"proficient":1}] I left them like that, having not much of a clue. I then added the framework to my site, and added three skills to a course. From then I created a quiz, gave it a passing grade, and attached a competency. I made a dummy user do the quiz, and when I look at the competencies, I get this: Why is the user not "proficient", if he successfully passed the quiz? Shouldn't the value be "competent", anyway, as the scale values were entered, rather than "proficient"?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Demonstrating proficiency
ResponsesInList.Text: For your competency scales, did you select the Proficient value as the default value? For the activities that awards the competency, there are several options. Unless you selected to the Upon Activity completion = Complete the competency. The Rating has to be manually completed by an Instructor or Administrator. If you did not choose a manual option for Activity completion, you should check your cron job, Site Admin>Scheduled Tasks>Complete learning plans which are due. It is also very important that all of the setup at the course + competencies are created before the student completes the activity that awards the competencies. There is no cron job to "back flush" and award competencies to activities in the past. Lastly, I use the excellent plug-in, Monitoring of learning plans - https://moodle.org/plugins/report_lpmonitoring This plug-in provides an easier, graphical view of a student's learning plan. This tool made me realize that creating scale values with Complete/Not yet complete are unnecessary. When a student does not achieve that competency they will have a Not Rated status. The only way a student can have a Not yet complete status is if an instructor or administrator manually selects that rating value. This is a lot of manual work using core Moodle Learning plans.
