ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Demonstrating proficiency
ResponsesInList.Text: Ignacio, Here is an explanation of the format for the scale imports in some detail. Here is the sample I'll explain. [{""scaleid"":""2""},{""id"":1,""scaledefault"":0,""proficient"":1},{""id"":2,""scaledefault"":1,""proficient"":1}] [ ] brackets surround the whole thing and each part is defined by curly braces {} separated by a comma. The first part, the scaleid, defines the scale to be used. The following part, with id:#, define the configuration settings for the default and proficient settings for each item in the scale you are using. This example has two items in its scale since there is an id : 1 and an id : 2 The Scale ID {""scaleid"":""2""} The scale id number here is the id number of the item in the database in the table mdl_scale. The two predefined ones that come with Moodle when installed are: 1 = Separate and Connected ways of knowing 2 = Default competence scale These are found and managed in Site admin > Grades > Scales. If you add a new one here, it will get id 3, unless you have already created one or more, in which case, it will get the next highest number. If you want to import a framework that uses that scale you added, then you would set the id to its number. So: {""scaleid"":""3""}. Don't import a framework with a scale number that you have not already defined in your site. How to determine a Scale id? Now, Moodle does not show the id number in the interface anywhere in Site admin > Grades > Scales, unfortunately. To find a scale id, you can check in the database or you can also find it at the end of the URL parameters in the address bar when you are editing a scale. So: https://yoursite.com/moodle/grade/edit/scale/edit.php?courseid=0&id=3 indicates I am editing scale with id 3. That's its scale id. (Warning: Do not depend on the order of the scales in Site admin > Grades > Scales to determine the id number! If you delete a scale, it is deleted from the system, so you will have less items in the your list than the id numbers. Use the URL or database directly to get the ID number of a scale.) The Default and Proficiency configuration {""id"":1,""scaledefault"":0,""proficient"":1},{""id"":2,""scaledefault"":1,""proficient"":1} There will normally* be one each of these for the number of items in the scale. In this case the scale has two items, which we happen to know are "Not yet competent" and "Competent". Each has a setting for whether it is the default action on completing a competency and whether or not it is on the list of scale items that can be manually awarded. "scaledefault" sets the first one, and "proficient" sets the second one. 0 means off and 1 means on. - For the first item in the scale, "Not yet competent" the settings for it are: scaledefault:0 which means it is not the default and the Proficiency is 1 or On, which means it can be manually awarded. - For the second item in the scale, "Competent" the settings for it are: scaledefault: 1 which means it IS the default and is on On, and the Proficiency is 1 or On, which means it can be manually awarded. How these settings looks in the interface in Moodle is shown in my screenshot attachment below. This is what I would call a normal or common way of doing this scale: automatic completion means being marked competent, and if manual set, the marker can choose either value to award. More than Two Items in a Scale If a scale has three items, then there will be three items here for the configuation; four, four and so forth. For example, if you created a scale with three values in it like this: Not yet competent, Competent with supervision,Competent indepedently, and set the second one to be default and include all of them in the manual awarding proficiency, then the data structure in the import/export for that will be this: {""id"":1,""scaledefault"":0,""proficient"":1},{""id"":2,""scaledefault"":1,""proficient"":1},{""id"":3,""scaledefault"":0,""proficient"":1} Recall the there can only be one item that is the scaledefault no matter how many items are in the scale. Only one will be set to 1. Any proficiency can be a 0 or 1, Off or On. *Normally: however Moodle exports themselves sometimes actually cheat on this and only indicate items with non-0 settings. This is the case in example 3-CCSS-ELA you put up. I have this same file and it exports the same thing. However, this is SLOPPY practice. Do not follow this example if you are making your own import files. It is good practice to explicitly indicate all the values for each of the scale items, like the example I started with above. Hope this is helpful. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Demonstrating proficiency
ResponsesInList.Text: Also, I put together a quick query to show the details of the scales in a site, including the scale id. It is here: https://docs.moodle.org/38/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports#Scale_details_with_ids

ResponsesInList.Title: Locked competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: Is it possible to have students align with specific competencies and not others. i.e. higher ability students only accessing higher ability competencies within a course and unable to move on unless these are completed. Or a higher ability student only able to access higher ability content within a course based on the competency associated with it?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Locked competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: I do not believe that is possible. Course restriction rules are based on activities or grades. Competencies are awarded after the successful completion of an activity or passing grade. We currently do not have any restrictions if a competency is not achieved. IMHO I would create two separate courses and enroll the students to the appropriate course. I would also consider the lower level course a perquisite to the higher level course. Kind regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Reset a competency rating
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle 3.6.  Just getting started setting up competency frameworks, learning plans, etc.  Set up test competency framework, attached to sample course activities , enrolled test accounts, etc. Did auto complete and manual for competency ratings. The question I have is what if a rating is accidentally assigned? Student 1 Student 2 Student 3 1 competent 2 uncompetent 3 hasn't completed the work yet. Editing teacher mistakenly assigns competent to student 3.   Only option is to mark it not competent, unless I am missing something. How would I reset the competency for student 3?  Or would Student 3 forever have attached to their record that they attempted the activity attached to the competency? Do I recreate the framework and hide the original one?  The 'bad' competency still shows.  Is it something that can be fixed from the back end, in the databases?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Reset a competency rating
ResponsesInList.Text: An administrator/instructor can manually select another rating and then delete the original "incorrect" rating that was selected. There is nothing that prevents an administrator from deleting any competency, good or bad.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Reset a competency rating
ResponsesInList.Text:
Thank you so much for your quick reply. Our site is hosted so I am wondering if perhaps I have not been given permission . 
Should I be able to delete the items listed at the bottom of this image?-

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Reset a competency rating
ResponsesInList.Text: It does look like you do not have permissions. I have a giant X in the right-hand corner of each competency.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Reset a competency rating
ResponsesInList.Text: Many thanks! I think this option will allow me to clean up the testing content and resolve any future mistakes. Thanks again!

ResponsesInList.Title: Sub-competencies and Rules
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I'm new to competencies and a bit confused about why competency rules can only be set for a parent competency. My goal is to create three sub-competencies that, when completed, would mark the parent competency as complete. Essentially looking like this: Parent Competency Sub-competency 1: Complete course A Sub-competency 2: Complete course B Sub-competency 3: Complete course C My issue is that I'm unable to set a competency rule for the the sub-competencies because they are not parents. This seems like it would be a common approach. What am I missing here? What would be another way to achieve this? Thanks in advance, Jon

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sub-competencies and Rules
ResponsesInList.Text: You can only create relationships between a Parent and its children within the same competency framework. The limitations of the parent-child relationships makes the setup challenging and hard to manage if there are any changes to the competency structure in the future. I set them up in an attempt to resolve the busy competency view of the Learning plan page for the student/instructor. They did not. I abandoned the concept - Arrange all of your children under one parent. Select the parent, Select the Edit>dropdown list. Select Competency Rule Select the desired Outcome value. Select the Save button. At the course level only the children are related, and awarded by courses activities . Since you have to add all of the children, you did not save an administration steps (clicks). Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Migrating Competency Frameworks
ResponsesInList.Text: Apologies if this was already asked previously. I wasn't able to find anything related to this. If I set up an updated competency framework and migrated the competencies in the courses to the new framework, what will happen to the learning plans, assuming that there are already students with progress? I'm thinking that we need to set up new learning plans and transfer the students to this new one. However, will the migration also migrate their completion of the competencies? I don't think that's included? Thanks to whoever will respond.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Migrating Competency Frameworks
ResponsesInList.Text: Why are you considering updating the competency framework? The students do not see the structure, the framework is only there for administrators of the structure. We have to live with what we created. Learning plans are within their own framework and it does not matter with the competencies are. The competencies linked to courses do not "care" where the competency is.

ResponsesInList.Title: Manage own learning plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, I am trying to give students the ability to add competences to their learning plan templates, but am having some trouble. I have set moodle/competency:planmanage to allow for the student role at the site level but when I log in as a student I still can't edit or add learning plans. Any assistance with this would be greatly appreciated. Cheers Vincent

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Manage own learning plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Try editing the authenticated user role, not the student role, following the instructions in the Competencies FAQ question" How can students create their own learning plans?"

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Manage own learning plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you that worked a treat!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Teacher Upload Evidence for Students
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle v3.5 and higher Scenario: Teacher observes student and takes photo on teachers phone. Later teacher goes to rate the students competencies in a learning plan. The teacher can add notes whilst they rate the competency, but how can they upload the photo as student evidence? I'm guessing that someone in the moodle community has already resolved this scenario challenge and it would be great to learn how. Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teacher Upload Evidence for Students
ResponsesInList.Text: You can upload the .jpg image as Evident of Prior Learning and then link the evident to an existing competency. In the learning plan the competency will be displayed with two elements. One the teachers rating and one with the evidence. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teacher Upload Evidence for Students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Shirley, Many thanks for a speedy response but... I think what you are suggesting can only be done by the student? My scenario is that the teacher should upload the evidence (whilst logged in as themselves) and then link the evidence to the student competencies. Is that possible? Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teacher Upload Evidence for Students
ResponsesInList.Text: I upload Evidence of Prior learning all the time for my students. I use this functionality to upload Training Certificates that they are awarded during external training events. If your teachers do not have the ability, consider changing the teacher's role permissions to allow that functionality. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Competencies - Parent
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle 3.8 How do I create a parent in the Competencies framework? I have created to Competency framework and would like to organise competencies under a parent. Can't find where to do it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies - Parent
ResponsesInList.Text: Moving to Competencies forum...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies - Parent
ResponsesInList.Text: in the Competency framework, select the Add new competency framework, Add a competency, that is the parent. Select the parent and then Add Competency, those are the children. Competencies cannot be moved, so consider how you will work with these objects before you setup a large framework. I recommended looking at your scales before you start adding competencies. Each competency requires a scale with a proficiency (default) value. I also recommend that you only use Scales with values that do not include, Not Rated or Not Yet Competent, Scales cannot be changes once the competency is awarded to a student. Consider, how the different views look and what the student/instructors will see before you create your scale values.

ResponsesInList.Title: Using a quiz, not competent showing blue in progress bar, not red
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, as per the description, when a student is marked not competent, using a quiz, the progress bar stays blue, and doesn't change to red to indicate to the student they need to resubmit. Is it just the way the quiz is, or have I missed something in the setup?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using a quiz, not competent showing blue in progress bar, not red
ResponsesInList.Text: This doesn't sound like a competency or learning plan question. 1. Does the quiz have a "passing" criteria? 2. Does passing the quiz award a competency to a student? 3. If it is only one student, did you look to see if they "passed" the quiz?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using a quiz, not competent showing blue in progress bar, not red
ResponsesInList.Text: Hey Shirley Yes on Q1 and 2, and all students. Everything works fine, showing competent, etc. Was just wondering about the completion progress bar not showing red if not competent. If they are in fact marked competent (or passed), it shows green, like it should.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using a quiz, not competent showing blue in progress bar, not red
ResponsesInList.Text: Competencies that are auto-awarded by activity completion work best with Scales = Competent, Completed, Proficient. One single value. Students who did not complete the activity are displayed as NOT RATED. My learning experience is to only create Scales with the single value - unfortunately this cannot be corrected. Scales cannot be changed after they are awarded, even if the one value is never awarded to a Student. Scales are very unforgiving. Competency that are manually rated by the Instructor can have multiple values for the Scale = Expert, Accomplished, Good, Fair, Needs Additional Effort. If I misunderstood your issue, please send a screen capture of the completion progress bar. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Competencies Linked to Multiple Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: I am new to Moodle and am having trouble grasping competencies and learning plans in terms of making sure that students pass the required courses in order to achieve a competency. I have a competency framework called 'Account Management' and within that framework, I have a competency called 'Quoting'.   I want to assign this competency to two courses, however require that both courses be completed in order to be competent in Quoting.  Is this possible?   Or, would they become competent if they passed only one of the courses? Thank you in advance!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies Linked to Multiple Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: As soon as the activity is completed the competency is awarded. The "workaround" to your use case, would be to have a single course, with two activities and the students needs to complete/pass both activity to be awarded to competency. Courses are shells that may contain multiple activities before a student earn competency.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies Linked to Multiple Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you! I suppose I could also just create sub-competencies for each course or require one course to have the other completed first. I appreciate your help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies Linked to Multiple Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: The parent-child relationships in the competency frameworks did not work as I expected and I abandoned those. Working with large competency structures (I have courses that award 18-20 competencies). in learning plans are cumbersome. Good Luck!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies Linked to Multiple Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Aaron, An alternative that may help is the Subcourse plugin: https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_subcourse . It's an activity that pulls in the final grade of another course into the course it is in. Since it is an activity it can have its own competency and do what Shirley suggested. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies Linked to Multiple Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Randy. I will check that out.

ResponsesInList.Title: how to connect quiz questions to competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, how to connect the quiz questions to competencies in Moodle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to connect quiz questions to competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: You cannot link quiz questions to a competency. You can link a quiz activity - with a "rule" when the competency will be awarded. If you have a set of questions that would award competency #1 and another set of questions that would award competency #2 - your options are two quizzes each quiz award the specific competency. Or if the students completes the quiz that is not randomized that has both sets of questions - and achieves the passing conditions is awarded the competencies. Kind Regards.

ResponsesInList.Title: Competency frameworks
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I am making a moodle course for several middle schools. The program has to follow government competency framework. I have been looking for explanations how to construct the CSV. I find in the moodle documentation information linking to other competency frameworks, which I downloaded, but I still don't understand. Sorry. 1. Scale values? Is there a format to follow? My settings needed should be straightforward. I get points from 0 to 10 (or 0 to 100), below 5 fails, 5 or above passes. 2. Scale configuration Where can I find the explanation? 3. Cross referenced competency id numbers. What are they? 4. Rule outcome and rule config? Seems useful, but I don know the format. 5. Taxonomy? Where can I find a description on how to format these fields? Kind regards, Boris

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competency frameworks
ResponsesInList.Text: Let me share my journey with the competency framework - I built my values based on previous work experience and needs. Cross referenced ID numbers. This is only allowed within the same Competency Framework. I have hundreds of smaller, structures so I cannot use this functionality. Rules and Rules outcomes you do not need to use. It is over-the-top. Taxomony is how do you categorize the "thing" the student achieved? Is is a Skill, Knowledge, Competency, ......what do you want to call it? For a Forklift driver maybe it should be a Skill. For Safety Training it is Knowledge. You can pick whatever term, but it really does not change the functionality. Good Luck.

ResponsesInList.Title: Auto set Comptetency Rating as "Competent" after finish activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I tried different settings competency framework and completion variants and never acquire a competency after passed the test. How correctly setup this? I don't want to do this manually.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Auto set Comptetency Rating as "Competent" after finish activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Are you testing this as a site admin or a student? Site admins can’t actually complete activities (completion is ignored) so if the competence is linked to an activity or course completion, you won’t see it automatically marked as competent.

ResponsesInList.Title: Odp: Re: Auto set Comptetency Rating as "Competent" after finish activity
ResponsesInList.Text: I added competency and linked it with activity as a site admin. Then I passed quiz on student account, but competency status is still Not yet competent. .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Odp: Re: Auto set Comptetency Rating as "Competent" after finish activity
ResponsesInList.Text: For the Quiz Activity, select Edit settings. At the bottom of the page, select the Competencies option. For the Course competencies, select the desired competency and then the Upon activity completion value = Complete the competency. Select one of the Save options.

ResponsesInList.Title: Odp: Re: Odp: Re: Auto set Comptetency Rating as "Competent" after finish activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Unfortunately it doesn't work. As a student in the competencies options inside course I go to competency and in Evidence field I see the text "The activity 'Quiz1' was completed." but it doesn't affect on state of Proficiency and progress bar in Competencies. Is it not depent on scale in competencies framework settings? I use default framework and scales and until I manually change proficiency on Competent that these is no effect in the competencies for student.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Odp: Re: Odp: Re: Auto set Comptetency Rating as "Competent" after finish activity
ResponsesInList.Text: For each competency who have to select the which Scale to use. Then you must Configure scales to select the default proficiency values. Note: I have custom scales. The Competency is then linked to the course and to the Course activity that awards the competency. The Course Activity: Competencies section - the course competencies and Upon Activity completion must be populated. the Upon Activity completion = Complete the competency . 1. If all of those settings are in place, check the course activity report. Have student's successfully completed that activity? 2. Does the Competency Breakdown Report update correctly for the Student's who have completed that activity? 3. Is your CRON jobs running for Complete learning plans which are due , Completion mark as started and Calculate regular completion data ? Once a proficiency is not working as expected, it has been my experience that I needed to manually correct it for each student. It is a best practice, when setting up a course, to review the student experience (course navigation/quiz activity) and then review the Admin/Instructor experience (reports and learning plans) before I release it for the intended audience. Using this process, I do not need to adjust manually a large population of student's course, quiz or competency values. Good Luck.

ResponsesInList.Title: Automatically Assign Learning plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, Can you assign a learning plan automatically to a user based on a profile field or any other criteria? Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatically Assign Learning plans
ResponsesInList.Text: You can assign automatically using cohort sync. 1. Create a cohort with the appropriate students. 2. From the Learning Plan template view, the column heading Cohorts has a number value, select the number and the Cohorts synced to this learning plan template page will be displayed. 3. Select the desired Cohort from the down drop list. 4. Select the Add cohorts button. The ongoing maintenance will only require you to add students to your cohort. All students added to the cohorts will be automatically added to the Learning Plan.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatically Assign Learning plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, Shirley. Worked for me

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatically Assign Learning plans
ResponsesInList.Text: And, if you use this plugin https://moodle.org/plugins/local_profilecohort you can put users in Cohorts automatically based on user custom profile field values. So you could use that to assign them to the relevant cohort which would then assign them to the proper Learning Plan(s)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competency - assignment linking to 2 competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: Did you set up the two competencies are a parent-child relationship in the competency framework? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competency - assignment linking to 2 competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: The options for awarding a competency Do Nothing (the instructor will manually rate this and award the competency) this is needed is you have various skill levels. Such as Expert, Advanced, Skills, Basic Understand, Improvement is needed. Attach Evidence, the instructor will manually rate this and award the competency after they review the attached evidence. If you are using the Assignment Course Activity this may be redundant...... Complete the Competency automatically awards the competency based on the related - course activity - completion rules.

ResponsesInList.Title: Can students choose learning plans?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can students choose learning plans?
ResponsesInList.Text: From a business stand point, these would normally be HR - soft skills courses. How to Manage Stress Working with others Time Management In Moodle from the student's Learning Plan page, they can select the Add New Learning Plan button and then add competencies directly from the competency framework. not something I would allow corporate learners.....but maybe other businesses don't have issues with this. For each competency, the student's would need to be able to either "request enrollment" or self-enroll.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can students choose learning plans?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Shirley let me describe the scenarios I've in my mind. In lots of industries  we can see a discussion about agile corporate mindsets and structures.  The is has massive consequences for L&D.  Typical L&D programs will run decentral and lots will be adhoc training offers and self organized trainings. The general expection for an employee is that s/he start activities and organizes learning  acitivities by self. If an employeee is interested in personal growth, getting new skills and competencies s/he should be able to identify  a learning plan and to enrole. I expect that we will have much less open central programs, much more decentral initiatives that are started  just a few weeks after identifying the need, working out loud circles und individuals that start their own journey. The role of an LMS will change in a  VUCA world. Ralf

ResponsesInList.Title: Linking competencies among courses

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Linking competencies among courses
ResponsesInList.Text: That functionality does not exist in Moodle core. The current UI does not allow competencies to move between frameworks. You can have multiple courses linked to the same competency, but you cannot link one competency to another unless it has the parent-child relationship within the same framework. IMHO the parent-child did not provide the functionality I  expected in my testing, The competency and Learning Plan template frameworks section of the UI needs to be rebuilt using the course catalog model.

There is no bug. I found my fault. I misunderstood the feature of default setting in competency scale configuration. The definition in default is used to mark a competency automatically. Its exactly explained in competency FAQ https://docs.moodle.org/36/en/Competencies_FAQ#What_is_the_difference_between_.27default.27_and_.27proficient.27_when_setting_up_scales_in_a_competency_framework.3F "The default value is what is displayed in the breakdown report and for a

ResponsesInList.Title: Thinking out loud:  A competency based Moodle site
ResponsesInList.Text: As a long time Moodler I started a few weeks ago thinking about use cases for competencies and learning plans in corporate or adult training program scenarios.  I would like to share and discuss my findings and ideas. Can we set up a Moodle site that is fully /mainly based on competency based learning/courses and how would it look like.? I'm not completely happy with my results, but it will be possible that I've overseen some options. But lets start at the beginning. We can create site wide or category related competency frameworks. A competency framework bundles several competencies and brings them into a hierachical order. Competency rules allows to defines rules that a user gets a top level competency if one or many other comptencies are met. Acitivity or course completion can be connected with one or many competencies. Its possible to connect the same competence in different courses. A participant can be enrolled into a learning plan. The user sees the learning plans and progress in the dashboard . When a learning plan is created  competencies are connected to the learning plan. Participants are enrolled to the learning plan via cohorts. Is it also possible for single learners? Its possible to define different levels of competencies. I.e. basic, standard, expert. How can we use it in a typical learning environment? For each learning topic and class level a competency framework is cretaed. They are connected to typical learning plans. At school it could be Class 8 English as a second language competency framework. Each teacher has an own classroom for each class in the term. He creates learning activties and connects them with competencies. Each students is connected with a learning plan (i.e. ESL class 8) The student can see the progress in dashboard. This model will work. But there are several issues I'm not happy with.: There are competencies that are not related to one topic only. (i.e. Presentation competency is an issue in German schools in class 8/9 in most topics for this class level). If each teacher adds activities for this competency students have to do  the same/similar very often and teacher don't see the progress/successs from other topics. As long as we have class and topic related courses teachers are isolated and everyone creates individual ressources, avctivities and didactical concepts. Cooperation and collaboration of teachers at schools are not part of their mindest (mostly here in Germany). So ist a lot of effort to create courses. This stops teacher to use a LMS intensive. Let me try to discuss an alternative model. Competency frameworks and learning plans are edited on site/category level. Courses are created for competencies not for classes. Instead of typical class and topic courses we create competency related courses. Its possible that for each competency several courses are available and the students enrolls themself. There are furthermore class/topic related courses. But the intention is different than typical. They are used for communication, some collaborative activities and final exam preparation. The student sees an overview about progress in the dashboard. This model tries  to push teachers to work collaborative and to use didactical scenarios from other teachers teaching the same topic. In some cases this could be  a little bit to radical/revolutionary. If this is your reality you can use the competency based courses as template and import them  into class related courses. I didn't check whether course related competency connections are included in backups.) What is missing? What I could not realize.... How can a teacher see the individual progress for a student? How can a teacher grade, comment the students activities? How can we limit the teachers access to his own students in the competency based courses? How can we implement didactical scenarios that needs group work? I also tried to understand how we can use taxonomies. After discussion with Mary we came to the result taxonomies are only descriptions. They are not related to any function.  Is this correct? Who can see the taxonomies? What do you think? Ralf This post was originally made in German community for didactical scenarios. https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=380558

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Thinking out loud:  A competency based Moodle site
ResponsesInList.Text: Ralf, Thank you for a well written use case. Competencies, Learning Plan (student level) and the Learning Plan Templates need additional UI functionality to make them truly usable. The current UI displays, were not intended for hundreds of competencies and learning plans that a corporation/or adult training programs require. Cannot move structures - Learning plans, competency frameworks, learning plan templates. Cannot link parent competency to a learning plan, and have all children related to the learning plan. Cannot Search the learning plan templates The current UI does not include  the functionality for students that require annual retraining to "retain" their current competency level or to improve on their current competency level. Functionality to set a competency framework, learning plan template or learning plan to "inactive" to retain the history of the objects and relationships. Deleting removes the history. Completion of a students learning plans to remove make it inactive is inappropriate, but it is the only option. Need the ability to "grandfather" a student for a competency and enter the dates of achievement. Students in the corporate world complete training outside of the LMS - and administrators often are provided evidence long after the course was completed. The taxonomies should be been at a system configuration level vs. the individual competency framework. These are just the thoughts off the top of my head.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Thinking out loud:  A competency based Moodle site
ResponsesInList.Text:
Thankyou Shirley for your post - some responses to points you raised are below: 
```text
Cannot link parent competency to a learning plan, and have all children related to the learning plan.
```
 When selecting a competencies, the competencies are displayed in an accessible tree which has some keyboard shortcuts that might help. '*' key expands all nodes in the tree 'shift' click will select all nodes in between two points in the tree. So you can quickly select all nodes in any branch of the tree. 
```text
"The taxonomies should be been at a system configuration level vs. the individual competency framework."
```
 The framework defines what the taxonomy should be and changing the taxonomy for one framework should not affect other ones. 
```text
Functionality to set a competency framework, learning plan template or learning plan to "inactive" to retain the history of the objects and relationships.
```
 This does exist already - when a new version of a framework is created, the old one can be set to not "visible" which retains and will show the history of objects and relationships, but will prevent the competencies in the "old framework" from being selectable
when adding competencies to a course / learning plans etc. There is then also the Migrate Frameworks tool to update all the competencies in courses from the old framework to the new one.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Thinking out loud:  A competency based Moodle site
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for your response. I was not totally clear on why the current competency to Learning Plan relationships are challenging in a corporate environment. The corporate learning world goes through business changes that obsolete, rename and reorganize data structures frequently. Selecting all of the children in the tree view quickly, is not an issue. Sequencing them by the ID vs. manually moving them one-by-one, like the course category would be the desired functionality. Setting framework to not visible (hide), did not remove the learning plan from the student's view during my initial testing. Maybe there is a cron job that needs to run, or run more often? Or the functionality does work as expected. I am not concerned an admin picking the wrong competencies, I am concerned with the students' view of their learning plan(s). The migrate frameworks is not that intuitive to use. I have looked at it several times, but moving course competencies from the old framework to a new course is not really the functionality I was looking for. I need to reorganize an existing structure, because my business reorganized a department. I need to move a framework to a new category.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: adding competency framework default to course
ResponsesInList.Text: Linking multiple course to a competency can be done, but once a student "earns" the competency on any course, there will be no compelling reason to complete the other courses. Normally, course to competency are a one-to-one relationship. Or some courses with multiple activities , may award multiple competencies. There is no search for competencies for students. You need to add the competencies to your courses and then set which course activities will award which competencies. You also need to link competencies to learning plan templates, and add students to learning plans. There is a large amount of administrative set-up and no delivered reports.

MDL-53346 would help resolve this somewhat bit I was wondering if anyone has a workaround that I may have missed? Short of getting the student to write down all the competencies required to complete a learning plan and then visiting the course competencies page to see which activities to do, the connection between a learning plan and a competency isn't sufficiently clear for students.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Activities displaying in learning Plan
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Richard, Your screen captures did not display correctly, so I cannot review them. But I suspect that they are correct. The next thing you will discover is how challenging it is to use competencies if you have a large course/competency structures, annual competency requirements, or large student (employee) populations. The use case for learning plans and competencies requires reports (views): By Learning plan template - display all related competencies (the current view for more than 3 competencies in a learning plan template is difficult to read - cannot reorder the competency by ID) By Learning plan to display all related students (currently cannot export all students with a learning plan) By competencies to display all students with a proficient value of Yes and the date/time stamp (who is competent to drive a forklift) By competencies to display all students with a proficient value of No (who cannot drive a forklift) Also, once a competency is awarded, it can only be deleted - If the wrong rating is applied the administrator cannot change the rating. Competencies cannot be end-date - so they cannot be reused for annual training requirements. Kind Regards, Shirley

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competency Framework optional fields description
ResponsesInList.Text: Within a competency family you can create "rules" between two of the children. You cannot create a "rule" between children of separate families. Depending on how to built your competency framework, the rules may or may not be usable. If you have a single parent that will have all the same scales, you may want to see where you would want to link children. If the student is awarded competency A they will also achieve competency B. I have many parents that use different scales - so I cannot use rules.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies over time
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Students' learning plan are not affected by course reset, but attached evidences coming from this course will be erased, and therefore we will have broken links in the learning plans. Maybe someone can give more precisions, but I think this is what will happen. If we think about an institution life-cycle, former year course will be erased, or maybe two or three years ago courses, and eventually we will have data in the data base (who and when acquired a competence, who validated it...) but some of the evidences will go away. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies over time
ResponsesInList.Text: If you need to retain the history of the student's competency, you should not use the course reset option. You could backup, restore a course as a "new" name and ID. Deselect the current enrollments and competencies to have a "fresh" course for new enrollments and if needed, a competency for the current year/skill. Best Regards, Shirley

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Learning Plans - options on Action pick list choices
ResponsesInList.Text: 1. Completing a Learning Plan for a student retains the historic training record and can be "uncompleted" by an administrator. 2. unlinking a learning plan from the template, freezes the student's learning plan in time and retains the historic record of the student's progress. We are using Learning plans for different sets of skills and each students has multiple plans. It would be nice if the Learning Plan page would reorder on the Status (Active vs Complete) column to improve the overall usability of this page.

ResponsesInList.Title: Can students choose a competency to attach to an assignment?
ResponsesInList.Text: I'd like to use competencies to allow student ownership of learning in a Digital Media Arts course. I want to give students an assignment with a specified technical or content goal, and then let them choose which additional competencies relating to artistic practice, critique / analysis, etc their work also demonstrates. Is this possible with Moodle competencies?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can students choose a competency to attach to an assignment?
ResponsesInList.Text: I *think* the tutor would need to add the range of competencies, and then the student could select which one they say they have provided evidence for in the normal way

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can students choose a competency to attach to an assignment?
ResponsesInList.Text: They'd need to add the range of competencies to *what*, the course or the assignment? Adding at the course level would be ideal for what I'm hoping. I want the student to choose which assignment(s) best demonstrate certain non-technical competencies.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can students choose a competency to attach to an assignment?
ResponsesInList.Text: Competencies are created in the Competency Framework. Existing competencies are "related" to a course. Courses can automatically "award" a competency when course activities are completed or they can be manually added by an instructor later. I have never tried to award a competency as a student - it may involve adding permissions to the student role. Best Regards, Shirley

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can students choose a competency to attach to an assignment?
ResponsesInList.Text: I think maybe I'm not choosing the right terminology here. I don't need students to award themselves the competency. I need students to be able to select which competency (out of the list of competencies associated with the course) that a particular submitted assignment should be included as evidence for. Then I should be able to review the course's associated competencies for that student, and see which assignments they've included as evidence towards that competency. I haven't yet been able to find this in the student workflow ... am I missing something obvious?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can students choose a competency to attach to an assignment?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Inside the courses, students are not able to select which activities can prove they are competent in a particular competence, but there is another way that can be useful for you: student learning profiles. If a student clicks on Profile > Learning plans, s/he will find, under the list of Learning plans, an option to add evidences (Links, Files). Once the evidence added s/he can link it to any of the competencies included in his/her learning plans. The problem here is that teachers will not see students' learning plans, as they are outside the courses. Extra permissions will need to be assigned to the person managing the assessment of these competencies. (Look https://docs.moodle.org/35/en/Learning_plan_supervisor , https://docs.moodle.org/35/en/Learning_plan_viewer and https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=370384 Cheers, R

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can students choose a competency to attach to an assignment?
ResponsesInList.Text: I have seen college level coursework, when the student's selected from the competency offerings for each course which competency they wanted to apply to their rubric. However, I cannot think of a systemic way of doing this in Moodle. You could include on the course summary page - a list of each of the competencies. Then add within the course a quiz activity with a single select one question. Each of competency is listed and the student "declares" which competency value is their goal upon course completion. When the course is successfully completed, the instructor can award the requested competency value. You would still need to build or the competency framework and relate them to the course. Consider how to build out your scales for the competencies before you implement. Such as; Submitted evidence for this competency, no submitted evidence, alternative evidence was submitted. Best Wishes, Shirley

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Awarding competencies on activity completion retrospectively.
ResponsesInList.Text: My experience is that you cannot do retrospective competencies that will automatically "rate" the students for past course completions. Competencies are created as of the current date, so they do not exist in the past. You can as an administrator manually rate each student for the competency, but there is no "gradebook" type of view for competencies...... That type of editable, view is missing from competencies and learning plans.

For me this would be critical, I think competencies management with Moodle in our faculty development system will be much more successful if we take into account past achievements. ResponsesInList.Text: I'm not convinced the end date is significant in the competencies being able to be completed: I think the key is that the default values are competent and proficient, so that when a competency is automatically met it shows as competent. One issue with competencies is that course teachers don't get the full view -for example if others rate competencies elsewhere, they won't show up as complete in the course. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies: Activity Grade based on "Complete the competency" and Completion Tracking
ResponsesInList.Text: Competencies should reflect the specific course objectives. Once a competency is earned, the student will not be required to complete any other course that awards the competency. Each course that you need a student to complete in their learning plan must have a unique competency-course relationship.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competencies: Activity Grade based on "Complete the competency" and Completion Tracking
ResponsesInList.Text: Your Construction Management course sounds like an apprentice program which has many courses the employee is required to complete in order to achieve apprenticeship. I have in the past created the 50 unique course elements, with unique competencies for each of the required skills. The Construction Management can be a certificate that requires the 50 competencies. I would not create one course with 50 elements. I might even consider breaking down the 50 elements into sub-categories - to keep the learners engaged with the apprentice process. The each quarters question needs some additional clarification from you. Do you have new employees each quarter for the same 50 courses? If so, just use cohort sync for the next quarters enrollment to the same 50 courses.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to get an outcome report for each student separately showing all the outcomes acquired in all the courses
ResponsesInList.Text:
Mario and Daniell, Here is a basic SQL query which will do what you want in a simple way. I did this in 3.1, I suspect it will work as is later versions, but I don't have the data to test at the moment on a 3.4 site. This is a basic report which shows the user, the course, the competency earned, its id, its framework name, the proficiency level, and date earned. Those are the basics. (Sorry, for the proficiency all that is easy to get from the database is the number because the scales are unfortunately not properly stored as a tables but as messy strings This will work in the Configurable Reports or the Ad-hoc database queries plugins. If you change the "prefix_" placeholder to your real prefix for table names, it should also work in external reporting tools such as Reportico, etc. 
```text
SELECT u.username,


u.firstname,


u.lastname,


c.shortname AS 'Course', 


cmp.shortname AS 'Competency',


cmp.idnumber AS 'Comp_id',


cmpf.shortname AS 'Framework',


cmpu.proficiency AS 'Proficiency',


DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(cmpu.timemodified), '%Y-%m-%d') AS 'EarnedOn'


FROM prefix_competency_usercompcourse cmpu 


JOIN prefix_user u ON u.id = cmpu.userid


JOIN prefix_course c ON c.id = cmpu.courseid


JOIN prefix_competency cmp ON cmp.id = cmpu.competencyid


JOIN prefix_competency_framework cmpf ON cmpf.id = cmp.competencyframeworkid


WHERE cmpu.proficiency IS NOT NULL


ORDER by u.username, c.shortname, cmp.shortname
```
 Please let me know if this works okay, and if so, I will add it to the Ad-hoc reports page. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to get an outcome report for each student separately showing all the outcomes acquired in all the courses
ResponsesInList.Text: By the way, strictly speaking, this will show users who have had some sort of rating for their proficiency, even if that proficient may be "Barely Competent" or some other rating, depending on the scale you are using. When a user has not been rated at all nor automatically earned a competency, then the database just has a NULL entry. If they earned, say a 0 level of proficiency, it will show on this report, which is why you will still need to know what the scale for the proficiency refers to. To make a really nice report that pulls in actual scale items would be much better done in PHP than SQL to be honest.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to get an outcome report for each student separately showing all the outcomes acquired in all the courses
ResponsesInList.Text:
Daniell, Apologies, I had assumed you were up on your SQL ;) That snippet goes into the first part of the statment with the other items in the SELECT section before the FROM. That section defines what columns appear in which order in the report. The order of sections is inavariable: SELECTs, then FROM, JOIN, WHERE, ORDER BY always in that order. But you can move the order of _columns_ inside the SELECT by swapping them around inside the SELECT section. In this case, I put user info first, then Course, etc. If you are happen to want to come to Montana to Mountain Moot this July, I will be teaching a class on beginning SQL and custom queries I put the Learning Plan column after Course, thus: 
```text
SELECT u.username,
u.firstname,
u.lastname,
c.shortname AS 'Course', 
(SELECT plan.name 
    FROM prefix_competency_plan plan
    WHERE plan.userid = u.id AND plan.templateid = cmp.competencyframeworkid
) AS 'LearningPlan',
cmp.shortname AS 'Competency',
cmp.idnumber AS 'Comp_id',
cmpf.shortname AS 'Framework',
cmpu.proficiency AS 'Proficiency',
DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(cmpu.timemodified), '%Y-%m-%d') AS 'EarnedOn'
FROM prefix_competency_usercompcourse cmpu 
JOIN prefix_user u ON u.id = cmpu.userid
JOIN prefix_course c ON c.id = cmpu.courseid
JOIN prefix_competency cmp ON cmp.id = cmpu.competencyid
JOIN prefix_competency_framework cmpf ON cmpf.id = cmp.competencyframeworkid
WHERE cmpu.proficiency IS NOT NULL
ORDER by u.username, c.shortname, cmp.shortname
```
 I hope this works and did not add any typos to it as I cobbled it together ;)

ResponsesInList.Title: Assigning Learning Plans to Users
ResponsesInList.Text: I am trying to set permissions so that a user can assign learning plans to a select group of individuals.  The user would only see that select group when assigning or viewing learning plans.  The concept would be very similar to setting up a course with "separate groups" configured and having a manager be part of that group. Ideally, when a user with the appropriate permissions clicked "Learning plan templates" they would see only an option to "create learning plans" in the Actions menu.  When selecting users to create learning plans for, they would only see users in the same group or cohort that they are currently in. I have attempted to use cohorts to limit the users displayed, but have not been successful.   Did I miss something?  I would really like to make this work, if anyone has suggestions, please help!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assigning Learning Plans to Users
ResponsesInList.Text: You can do this with the "User Cohort Roles" tool. You need to create 2 roles - one to be assigned at the system context - and one to be assigned for each user in the cohort. The first role "LP Manager System" needs to have: "moodle/site:configview" (Moodle 3.2 only) "moodle/competency:templatemanage" "moodle/competency:templateview" The second role "LP Manager User" needs to have: moodle/competency:planmanage moodle/competency:planreview moodle/competency:plancomment Then create a cohort containing the students to be managed - and use the admin tool "Users -> Permissions -> Assign user role to cohort" to assign the "LP Manager User" role to every student in the cohort. Assign the manager user the first role at the system context (Users -> Permissions -> Assign system roles) After doing this, the manager should see the learning plan templates page and be able to assign templates to users - but only the users from the cohort.

The other part of my question focused on the ability to separate the permission to "Create a new learning plan" from the ability to "Add new learning plan template" and the ability to edit, duplicate, and delete learning plan templates.  In this case, the "Add new learning plan template" button would not be visible to the LP Manager System, and the edit menu would only display the option to "Create new learning plan".

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assigning Learning Plans to Users
ResponsesInList.Text: Just a note that this will not work in Moodle 3.1 because the capability "moodle/site:configview" does not exist there yet. Which means such a role can't get to the Site admin menu to be able to add a user to a Learning Plan. So, it will not work in most cases, as you would not want to grant site:config to such users, which is far too dangerous. You'd have to give such a LP assigner some other way to get to site admin menu, which bascially defeats the purpose of having a limited role to do just this one task of assigning LPs to users. Works as described in 3.2 where this capability exists.

ResponsesInList.Title: Managing expiry date of accreditations/ competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Is there any way to track accreditations within moodle? The scenario would be: - A user is added to a learning plan. - That learning plan has a number of competencies. - The user achieve these competencies by completing a number of courses. - After completing all course in the learning plan the user is set as accredited for that area of knowledge. - In x years time his accreditation will expire and he would need to enrol in a course/courses again to update his accreditation. Thanks Teresa

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Managing expiry date of accreditations/ competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: There are some ways to do something similar to what you describe. E.g. You can make learning plans expire on a specified date. You can create duplicate a competency framework annually and you can migrate courses from one version of a competency framework to the next (without having to manually update all the courses). These features can be put together to require someone to annually re-achieve a competency (which is a actually a new competency for every year). Expiring a competency after a time period or on a certain day has been mentioned but I don't think anyone has created a tracker issue for it (it seems like a good idea).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Managing expiry date of accreditations/ competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: Has there been any development on this topic? I would love to be able to set this up to manage credentialing for our students. Would there be anything that could track external certification expiration as well? I hope all is well!

ResponsesInList.Title: Reopening learning plan?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, When i reopen learning plan it gives an warning; "Reopen the learning plan 'XXXXXX'? If so, the status of the users' competencies that was recorded at the time the plan was previously completed will be deleted, and the plan will become active again." But is anything actually destroyed/lost besides Status that changes from "complete" to "active" ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Reopening learning plan?
ResponsesInList.Text: When a learning plan is completed, the state of all the competencies in the plan is frozen at the point in time the plan was completed. So if student A has a plan which is completed in January - but they only achieved 1 / 5 competencies from their plan - the plan will always reflect 1 / 5. If in February, then go on to complete all 5 competencies (maybe in another course), the plan will still say 1 / 5. If the plan is re-opened - the "frozen state" of the plan is deleted - the plan will now say 5 / 5 completed and there will be no record of what their progress was in January.

ResponsesInList.Title: ACGME Competency Framework
ResponsesInList.Text: Please share your views and latest frameworks created for ACGME core competencies used in medical schools

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: ACGME Competency Framework
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Samal I think you talk  about Milestones. Milestones As the ACGME began to move toward continuous accreditation, specialty groups developed outcomes-based milestones as a framework for determining resident and fellow performance within the six ACGME Core Competencies. What are Milestones? Simply defined, a milestone is a significant point in development. For accreditation purposes, the Milestones are competency-based developmental outcomes (e.g., knowledge, skills, attitudes, and performance) that can be demonstrated progressively by residents and fellows from the beginning of their education through graduation to the unsupervised practice of their specialties. Who developed the Milestones ? Each specialty’s Milestone Working Group was co-convened by the ACGME and relevant American Board of Medical Specialties (ABMS) specialty board(s), and was composed of ABMS specialty board representatives, program director association members, specialty college members, ACGME Review Committee members, residents, fellows, and others.

ResponsesInList.Title: can student rate the competencies of the course??
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, can student rate the competencies of the course? if currently, students can't do that is it possible to do it by changing one of the capabilities or by any plugin I really appreciate any help you can provide.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: can student rate the competencies of the course??
ResponsesInList.Text: There is not a way to directly rate competencies that I know of, but you could set up a feedback or questionnaire to do that. Also, if you wanted to do it simpler than those two options, you could use the HotQuestion activity as a competency rating or suggestion box with vote capability on each entry. Full disclosure, I currently maintain the HotQuestion plugin. You could also try the Poll block.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: can student rate the competencies of the course??
ResponsesInList.Text: We (Dutch Moodle users at our Moot last week) happen to have discussed possibilities for this. If you mean rating competencies in the same way a teacher would do for a student, but more in a peer assessment kind of way, you could try one of the custom roles for this. A huge note of caution though: in peer assessment it's most useful to have at least 3 assessments per user, to have a nicely balanced score/rating. With the current set up of reviewing and rating competencies, this can not be done: 1 rating per competency. This probably has to do with the nature of CBL/CBE and the preferred 'competent/not yet competent' scale for this. In such a black-and-white situation, there is no place for multiple assessments/ratings for any given competency: you're either competent or you're not.

ResponsesInList.Title: Competence Frameworks - how far to drill down Vs courses...
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings all, I am not sure where I should post this, so starting here, let me know if it should be elsewhere. MOODLE v3.2 - Competence Frameworks, I am creating a framework at site level (we have no defined standard internationally or nationally).  I have my 5 top level competencies, and I am breaking them down into smaller chunks against which activities will be judged. What I want to know, is at what level I should be defining, or breaking down the competencies into performance criteria at the framework level  and where I I stop and then have the remainder defined within a course.   This is hard to explain. For example, if I have a top level competence, say COMMUNICATE then that is one of the top level competence elements in the framework.   Then say I am testing communication in terms of written and oral.  So I have two subcompetencies COMMUNICATE - written and COMMUNICATE- oral.  Then the written communication requires that the people use the correct systems or technology, use appropriate language, and, say, cover the right material.  Should those three sub-sub-competencies be in the framework, or in the course? Is there any kind of standard that anyone knows of? Many thanks for any thoughts, or any advice on where else this kind of topic is discussed, I know it isn't really to do with moodle, moodle is just the tool, but I figured someone here might have hit this problem before me! Cheers Michelle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competence Frameworks - how far to drill down Vs courses...
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Michelle, This is more a CBE (Competency Based Education) question than a tool one, but I'll see if I can help you (as the topic has my particular interest). The key is to be as concrete as possible when elaborating the competencies in your framework, limiting each competency to one specific behaviour/skill/situation. For your example, this could mean: Communicate Oral Informal I can have a phone conversation I can ask questions about something personally relevant, such as directions to the nearest bus stop etc... Formal Written Informal I can write a post card from my vacation address I can IM with a friend I can write a status update for my social media Formal I can write a formal letter to apply for a job I can write a resumé to accompany my job application I can write an email to a potential employer to apply for a job And so on... one good source for this elaborate breakdown of competencies/skills/can-do statements is the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages, aka CEFR. If this is not a foreign language thing you're after, you might want to look into descriptors for soft skills, that are bound to be out there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competence Frameworks - how far to drill down Vs courses...
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joost! Thanks for the reply,  I have done more research and thought and discussed this at work.  I am going to add one thing.  Thanks for your post, that helped to get me started! Basically I have decided to split the framework elements Vs course measurables using elements that are non-perishable (and hence in framework which stands the test of time) Vs perishable (measurable in course that might change in the future). i.e.  Oral - informal and Oral - Formal would be part of the framework, we can assume that these will be required forever (non-perishable).  However, the medium used for oral communication (phone/video.) is perishable, the phone may cease to exist, video may become hologram (?!) .  I'd argue that the ability to ask questions is non-perishable, where as using a particular system (phone/twitter/facebook etc) are perishable.  So I'd be putting the system based performance criterion in the course, and the non-perishable in the framework. Does this sound sensible to others? Joost, should I be adding this to CBE discussion? Not sure where that is.... Thanks! Michelle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Competence Frameworks - how far to drill down Vs courses...
ResponsesInList.Text: It sounds sensible to me... focus on behaviors, skills (or whatever taxonomy you plan to use) and make them about as specific as is needed, without restricting a behavior to a tool that's presently being used for it. You're right in saying that communication skills don't necessarily depend on the tool used: even when humans used drums or smoke signals, they still needed to master the skill of asking questions, answering them and exchanging information in an efficient way. Same goes for computer skills: tool-related stuff can be managed in in-course tasks (being able to store a document made with MS Office Word on a laptop by using the short key Ctrl-S), whereas the skill 'I can create, edit and save a text document' would be handled in a competency framework.

ResponsesInList.Title: Multiple activities to complete one competency
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I would like to have one competency automatically marked as completed when all activities linked to this competency are completed. For example, I have an " Introduction to computers " course, for which I created a " Can use Windows Explorer, files and folder " competency. During the course, I present my students several activities related to this competency (book, quizz, etc.) I would like the competency " Can use Windows Explorer, files and folder " to be automatically met when all linked activities are completed. Is it possible, or should I use the "show evidence/manual rating" way ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities to complete one competency
ResponsesInList.Text: One way that springs to mind is that for one of the activities, you could set the activity completion so that it is only marked complete when (a) whatever that activity completion's requirement is  AND (b) when the other activities are also marked complete. Then you can set that activity as the one that triggers the competency completion.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities to complete one competency
ResponsesInList.Text: Mary's solution sounds sensible, but you could also consider breaking the competency down a bit further by creating children of it that are linked to the individual activities, and marking the parent competency complete when all children are completed. This can be done by adding a competency rule to the parent competency from the competency frameworks administration section (Edit competency framework).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities to complete one competency
ResponsesInList.Text: There's a bit about what Joost says in the Competency framework documentation. It reminds me it would be a nice thing to elaborate on in the docs.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities to complete one competency
ResponsesInList.Text: I could draft a text on this for you to review, on the docs, if you want to...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities to complete one competency
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi ! Thanks for your useful suggestions. I will try to elaborate on this to reach my goal This takes place in a very formal situation, related to the educational structure in Belgium. If someone is interested, I can give more explanations about this and how I try to use the competency framework to follow the formal guidelines we're given... As a starter, I join an "Educational file" which is the base for an "MS Excel" course. The main points are "Learning outcomes (capacités terminales)", which must all be met for the student to succeed. Each one of those are quite general/vague (encode and treat data, present results in a graphical form,...) and has to be broken down into several criteria, more precises. This is arbitrary, the teacher can follow his pedagogical methods, the official program defined for the course, etc. to create his criteria. Basically some moodle activities would be related to some criteria, and once all or a defined part of them are met, then the "parent outcome" would then be marked as completed. When all the outcomes are met, then the student succeed for the course. The point is, those criteria cannot be evaluated on a single activity, and multiple activities should be involved in one of them (this was the original meaning of my question). So both your suggestions are helpful, Mary's one for the last part, and Joost's one for the structure of the course itself. I will try to implement both and see how it works

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple activities to complete one competency
ResponsesInList.Text: Bonjour Lapin Blanc. (It's not a requirement at all but it would be nice to know your real name- I doubt you are actually a lapin blanc, but who knows ) You have two ways of doing this -mine with activity completion and Joost's with completion rules. I'll outline my way for now: 4 activities each with completion settings. One of them has to have Restrict access on it  -it will only become visible when the other three have bee marked complete. Then when this fourth activity is complete, the competency can be met. Because in order for the fourth activity to be visible the other three activities must already have been completed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatic Competency ID Number by default
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi François, JIRA is a bit of a strict system. In order to be able to post an issue in the Tracker, you have to vote for a number of related issues, so you can prove you're a human being. This prevents the Tracker from being spammed by bots and other things. As for the competency ID numbering, I normally work with a spreadsheet program, set the framework ID to 1000 for instance, the main categories within the framework to 1001, 1002, 1003, etc, and then use the spreadsheet to auto +1 the value for every competency in there. Automating this in the interface may seem like a useful feature, but working with a framework of over 100 competencies, it's a bit of a task keeping track of all the layers and subcompetencies. You have to keep track of the parent competencies and their ID numbers in order to be able to correctly relate them. I found working with a spreadsheet > CSV a lot faster than the interface.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automatic Competency ID Number by default
ResponsesInList.Text: Hmm, I think for categories, there are 2 'ID numbers': 1 autonumbered which is also the database ID number corresponding to the category, and 1 optional value that just displays in your category management section. If the developers used this to model the competency settings page, it makes sense that the competency ID number is an optional value, only to be used for reference. And for auto numbering, you'd have to allow for instances who want an alphanumerical ID number, instead of just a numerical value, like 'e1234c345b1' It might be an interesting addition to the interface and workings, and it could be part of improvements to the interface.

ResponsesInList.Title: Issue with Learning Plan Monitor and unrated competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: I've created a competency framework and learning plan. I've associated a competency with 2 courses. I rate the competency in each course for a student using the "Competency breakdown" report. In one course the competency is rated "competent" in the other "not yet competent". The "Monitoring of learning plans" report looks as it should: - the total number of ratings is 2/2 - the rating chart shows half "not yet competent" (yellow) and half "competent" (green). Rating count for "not yet competent" and "competent" is 1 each - the final rating is "Not yet competent" and "Not proficient" When I do something similar for another student, but only rate the competency in one course as "competent" and leave the other unrated, the "Monitoring of learning plans" report looks like: - total number of ratings: 1/2 - the rating chart is all competent (green), the rating count is "not yet competent: 0", "competent: 1" - the final rating is "Competent" and "Proficient" Is this expected behaviour? I'm using Moodle 3.1.4+ (Build: 20170209) with Monitoring of learning plans plugin 1.0.0 Thanks, Rob

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with Learning Plan Monitor and unrated competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello there. I presume you are using this learning plans monitor plugin? https://moodle.org/plugins/report_lpmonitoring I am going to move your post to the Competencies forum - even though it is actually related to a plugin. I feel the Competencies experts frequent that forum and it might be the best place for help

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with Learning Plan Monitor and unrated competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm not fully aware of the inner workings of this plugin, but it kind of makes sense. In situation 1, you rated both competencies, hence the 2 colors in the chart (1 for each rating). Since the rating chart only records rated competencies, in this case it displays the status of the 2 rated ones (2 out of 2). In situation 2, you only rated 1 of 2 competencies. The rating chart only displays the breakdown of rated competencies (the other one does not have a status 'rated' or a rating associated with it), so it will only show the 1 color. The hint is in the mention of total number of ratings being 1/2. You would expect a chart showing something like 50% grey and 50% color of the rating, if it would display all competencies rated/unrated and then broken down, but I suspect this is not how this chart works.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with Learning Plan Monitor and unrated competencies

Student1 has been rated as "competent" in one course and "not yet competent" in the other. Student 2 has been rated as "competent" in one course and is not rated in the other. For student1, the learning plan shows "not competent, not proficient" for the competency. The rating for both competencies are shown. For student2, the learning plan shows "competent, proficient" for the competency. The rating is only shown for the competency that was rated. If a competency is based on more than one activity or course, the student is given a false perception that they are proficient in that competency after the first activity or course is rated. Any thoughts on how to avoid this? I don't see a way to give the competency a "not yet competent" rating as a default. Thanks, Rob

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with Learning Plan Monitor and unrated competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rob, Setting the competency to default 'not yet competent' can be done from two places, if I'm correct: - at competency level in your framework, by using a custom scale (you have to edit the competency and modify the scale in the settings page) - at framework level, changing the scale settings and values from the respective settings page.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with Learning Plan Monitor and unrated competencies
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joost, I don't think that is what the "Default" setting on the scale does. It is used to assign a competency level for an activity that is automatically rated. If your scale has more than one setting for "proficient" (eg just competent, competent, highly competent), this allows you to set which value will be used. Here's the blurb from the documentation: The default value is what is displayed in the breakdown report and for a student in their learning plan when a competency is automatically met upon activity completion. We have recently upgraded to Moodle 3.2.2+ (Build: 20170331), which has an updated version of the Monitoring of Learning Plan plugin: 1.1.1 (Build 2016120500).
